loans.name: Magali

texts.es: Magali tiene 20 años y vive en compañía de su madre en casa de sus progenitores. Hace más de 6 años se dedica a la venta de verduras como: lechuga, espinaca, cebolla entre otros productos más, en un mercadillo cerca de su casa. Trabaja junto a su madre, quien la ayuda en el negocio, y ambas se van en busca de la mercadería de los mismos productores. Su horario de trabajo va desde muy temprano hasta las 3 de la tarde, tiempo en el que ha logrado acumular buenas ganancias del día; además que le permite tener sus propios ingresos y aportar en la economía de su casa. Magali tiene muchos sueños, es por eso que  trabaja con mucha cautela y seguridad, ya que su fin es tener un puesto más amplio, para así aumentar de mercadería, con mayor variedad de productos. Es el crédito numero 3 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más verduras para surtir su puesto.
texts.en:
Magali is 20 years old and lives with her mother in her parents' house.  She has been selling vegetables such as lettuce, spinach, onions and others in a street market near her home for more than 6 years.  She works with her mother who helps her in the business. They both go looking for merchandise from the farmers themselves.  Magali works every day from very early in the morning until 3 o'clock in the afternoon by which time she has made good profits for the day.  This work allows her to have her own income and put money towards her household finances.

Magali has a lot of dreams which is why she works very carefully and safely.  Her goal is to have a much bigger stall so that she can increase the amount of merchandise she sells, with a wider range of products.

This is Magali's 3rd loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people she knows.  All the bank's members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to everyone who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will use her loan to buy more vegetables to stock her business.

loans.use: To stock her sales stall with a wider variety of vegetables

loans.name: Vilma Mery

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene  03 hijos independientes, la señora estudió educación superior.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 09 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá para comprar lanas de colores oscuros  y botones para sus tejidos como chompas, suéteres, etc. 

Su visión es mejorar el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción conversar con las socias.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 60 years old, married and has three grown up children who live independently.  Vilma completed her higher education.

Vilma has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 9 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling handicrafts.

Vilma's new loan is for 1,000 Peruvian soles which she will invest in buying dark-colored yarn and buttons for her knitted items such as sweaters.  Her vision for the future is to improve her business and her profits.  What she likes about her community bank are the meetings because it is fun to chat with the other members.

loans.use: To buy dark-colored yarn and buttons for her knitted sweaters

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz de 43 años, es una mujer trabajadora que le ha gustado siempre tener su propio dinero por eso decidió tener la profesión que su mama le enseño cuando ella era pequeña. 

Viviendo en una zona en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas) ha estado trabajando sola todos los días haciendo costura y confeccionando ropa por los pedidos que les hacen los clientes. Confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas a sus clientes ha incrementado su negocio. 

Para continuar con su taller de confección y costura de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y otra parte invertirla en el negocio de su esposo y así generar más ingresos para su familia. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de costura bien surtido.
texts.en:
Cruz is 43 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has always liked having her own money.  For this reason, she decided to work in the profession that her mom taught her when she was little.

Cruz lives in an area called Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads, whose houses are in the mountains).  She works alone every day sewing and making clothes to fill orders that her customers make.  She makes pants, dresses and blouses for her customers and has increased her business.

To continue with her dressmaking workshop, she would like to use some of her loan money to buy fabric and invest the rest in her husband's business so that they can make more income for their family.  In the future, she would like to have a well-equipped dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Carmen Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rocio; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, chompas, polos, casacas y blusas, ella vende en forma independiente y ella también trabaja en la municipalidad en el área de mantenimiento, la socia quiere tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Rocio is a member of the 'Teresa de Jesús' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Carmen Rocio is 37 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  Carmen Rocio sells pants, sweaters, polo shirts, jackets and blouses.  She sells independently and also works for the city as a maintenance worker.  She would like to have a store in which she can sell her clothes.  She is requesting a loan to buy clothes wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 38 años, vive con su 3 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura ya que desde su niñez, siempre ha cultivado papa, habas maíz y otros productos nativos de la zona.  Siendo esta actividad apoyada por sus hijos, tanto en la siembra como en la cosecha, En ocasiones cuando el trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo, contrata peones para dicha tarea. Sin embargo ha tenido problemas en la cosecha debido al mal tiempo que se presentaba perjudicándolo. Para el futuro espera mejorar e intensificarse en la agricultura. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y el pago de alquiler de yunta (instrumento de madera que se utiliza para remover la tierra) que los usará para su tiempo de siembra.
texts.en:
Mónica is 38 years old.  She lives with her three children in her own home.  She has been farming all her life, since she was a child.  She has always grown potatoes, beans, corn and other products which are native to the area.  She is supported in her business by her children, both in sowing her crops and in harvesting.  Occasionally, when the work requires a lot of effort, she hires laborers for the task.

Mónica has had problems with her harvest owing to the bad weather which the area has had, damaging her crops.  In the future, she hopes to improve and intensify her farming.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a member of her community bank because she knows all the members and they are responsible and very supportive of each other.  Mónica would like to thank everybody who will help make her loan possible since it will be very useful to her and help her make progress in her business activity.  She will invest her loan in buying sacks of manure and paying to hire a yoke (a wooden instrument which is used to turn over the land).  She will use it at sowing time.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and to pay to hire a yoke

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de viajes, ella tiene una agencia que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la agencia de viajes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the 'Teresa de Jesús' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Edith is 38 years old and lives with her partner.  She has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her travel agency business.  She has a travel agency where she serves from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business she is getting her children ahead in life.  Edith would like to improve and expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to keep her travel agency running.

Edith is happy to be receiving her loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep her travel agency running

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha es una pequeña comerciante, que gracias a su empeño al trabajo administra su pulpería desde hace nueve años. Iniciando con pocos productos, ya que su capital era poco, parte de su dinero era su liquidación, y el apoyo de su esposo, el cual trabaja como contador.
Con el financiamiento que Afodenic da, comienza ah invertir en una variedad de productos como: cosméticos logrando así  aumentar sus niveles de ventas.
Con este préstamo será para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, productos de limpiezas entre otros para aumentar el capital y mantener a la venta siempre productos de consumo diario ya que se mueve más el dinero. Logrando así cumplir con sus pagos y necesidades personales
texts.en:
Martha is a small saleswoman who, thanks to her commitment to her work, has been running her own grocery store for nine years.  She started out with only a few products since she didn't have much capital.  Part of the money was her redundancy money and some came from her husband who is an accountant.

With loans from Afodenic, she has started to invest in a variety of products such as cosmetics, thereby increasing her sales levels.

Martha will use this loan to buy basic grains, candies, soda, cleaning products and other products to increase her capital.  She will keep selling essentials since they sell the best.  This will help her to meet her repayments and cover her personal needs.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, candies and soda to increase her sales levels

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es:
Arlen es una mujer emprendedora, que se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosmético, negocio que viene aumentando desde hace cuatro años, también trabaja como maestra de primaria por la mañana. Teniendo un dinero fijo.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con capital propio, y dinero que su esposo dio, por medio de su trabajo como albañil. Luego para aumentar sus ventas de productos busca alternativas para vender variedad, siendo Afodenic que por medio de sus financiamientos compra más cosmético de Vogue, ropa. Lo que logro más captación de clientela.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en mas ropa de niño, cosméticos, zapatos gran parte de estos productos son encargados, así como la compra de muchos perfumes de dama y caballeros. Esperando tener mejores colocaciones en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Arlen is an entrepreneurial woman who sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics as a part-time business which she has developed over the last four years.  She also is a primary school teacher in the mornings and has a steady income.

She began her business with her own capital and the money given to her by her husband who works as a bricklayer.  To increase sales she wanted to add variety to her products and through the loans provided by Afodenic she was able to purchase Vogue cosmetics and clothing, thereby developing her customer base.

The new loan is to be used to purchase more children's clothing, cosmetics and shoes, all of which have to be ordered.  She'll also buy more women's and men's perfumes.  Hopefully in this way she can improve sales.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, cosmetics and perfumes to increase sales

loans.name: Arly Antonio

texts.es:
Arly es un  hombre trabajador, de oficio mecánico industrial, con doce años de experiencia, y también posee sus maquinas para hacer costura, el cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es costurera. 
Juntos han venido logrando la construcción de su casa, con el crédito anterior lograron avanzar con el porche, ya que ha venido haciendo estas mejoras por medio del financiamiento de Afodenic quien ha dado una mejor vivienda atreves de sus préstamos con plazos que satisfacen sus expectativas.
Con este nuevo préstamo lograra la terminación de su porche ya que cerrara por completo. Para esto comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, cemento, hierro
texts.en:
Arly is a hard worker in the industrial mechanical trade, with twelve years of experience.  He also owns sewing machines and has the support of his wife who is a seamstress.  

Together they have been building their house and with previous loans were able to start on the porch.  Through the Afodenic loans, which offered payment terms meeting their expectations, they were able to make the home improvements done so far.

With the new loan they plan to finish the porch so that it is completely closed off.  To do this they need to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement and steel.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as bricks, sand, cement and steel to finish the porch

loans.name: Yanina Abdulia

texts.es:
Yanina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito Puno y  provincia de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene estudios de educación superior técnico.

Está  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 04 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de artículos artesanales.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar lanas, crochet y palitos para su tejido de chompas.

Su visión en el negocio es posicionarse en el negocio de la artesanía y generar mayores ingresos.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y las dinámicas  en las que participa.
texts.en:
Yanina is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 33 years old and lives with her partner.  They have two children.  Yanina studied at an institute of technical education.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles which she invested in her business selling handicrafts.

Yanina will use her new loan for 400 Peruvian soles to buy yarn, crochet hooks and needles for knitting her sweaters.

Yanina's vision for her business is to position herself in the handicrafts business and make more profits.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan and the dynamic nature of the group.

loans.use: To buy yarn, crochet hooks and needles for knitting her sweaters

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 44 años, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 10 años expende comida a clientes fijos, que trabajan en diversos puntos de su ciudad, es entonces que todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para preparar los diversos platillos que le piden sus comensales.  Su buen gusto por la comida, le ha dado mucha ventaja, ya que así ha logrado ganar más clientes que requieren de su servicio, esto ha hecho que mejore sus ganancias. Disfruta de realizar este trabajo porque le permite disponer de sus horarios, ahora su prioridad es lograr tener un restaurante. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos no perecibles al por mayor que son los ingredientes que necesita para prepara sus platillos.
texts.en: Sara is 44 years old. She lives with her 3 children and her husband in a rental home. For over 10 years she has sold food to regular customers who work in different parts of the city. For this she wakes up very early every morning to prepare the various dishes ordered by her guests. Her good taste in food has helped her in many ways. It has allowed her to win more clients who need her services, and so improving her profits. She enjoys her work because it allows her to make her own schedule. Now her priority is to be able to get a restaurant. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She thanks those people who will become the agents of the loan she is requesting. The loan will very much help the progress of her economic activity. She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of wholesale non-perishable food items. These are the ingredients she needs to make her dishes.

loans.use:
Comprar productos no perecibles.
Buy non-perishable products

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.es: Stephanie tiene 20 años, vive solo con sus padres y sus abuelos en la propiedad que poseen. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de ropa, mercadería que lleva vender a sus amigas que estudian con ella en estudios superiores. Asegura, que es más fácil realizar sus ventas en su salón porque le permite hacer un seguimiento de sus cuentas, ya que cobra cada día a sus compañeras. De esta manera logra tener las ganancias, además siempre esta al tanto de las nuevas tendencias de la moda, por lo que compra y se abastece de prendas con los nuevos diseños, esto le favorece ya que rápidamente su mercadería es vendida. Por las ventas exitosas que ha tenido ha decidido crecer su capital para poder solventarse mejor sus gastos. Es el crédito número 9 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en más mercadería en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Stephanie, 20, lives with her parents and grandparents in the property they own.  For the last year she has been selling clothes, merchandise she takes to sell to her friends who are going to college with her.  She assures us that it’s easier to sell in the classroom because she can follow up on her accounts since she collects daily from her friends.  This way she’s able to earn more profits plus she’s always up to date on the latest fashion trends so she stocks up on the newest designs of clothes.  This is favorable for her because she sells her merchandise quickly.

Because of the successful sales she’s had she wants to increase capital in order to pay her expenses better.  This is her 9th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive people she knows.  She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested loan to invest in more items of clothing.

loans.use: To buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres en L. propiedad que poseen. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a L. agricultura, desD. entonces aprendió todo lo necesario sobre las técnicas agrarias. Ahora lo aplica sobre sus propios terrenos, cultivando papa, maíz, habas entre otros productos, asimismo se dedica también a L. crianza D. vacas y ovejas que tiene en su propio establo. Sus padres L. apoyan en esta decisión, D. ser independiente en L. administración D. sus terrenos y es una fuente D. ingreso para su familia. Diariamente no deja D. trabajar en  el cuidado D. sus cultivos y sus animales  ya que esto le ha permitido tener mejores rentas en L. venta D. sus cosechas y D. los animales que realiza D. manera periódica. Su sueño es tener un establo granD. y más extensiones D. terreno. Es su crédito numero 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su actividad económica. El dinero lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono, fertilizantes y semillas mejoradas así como vitaminas para mejorar L. salud D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 23, lives with his parents in the property they own.  Since his childhood he’s been in farming.  Since then he learned everything necessary about agricultural techniques.  He now applies all that to his land growing potato, corn and lima beans among other products.  He also raises cows and sheep that he keeps in his own stable.  His parents support his decision to be independent and administer his own lands and it is a source of income for his family.

He works caring for his crops and animals every day because this has allowed him to earn better profits when he sells his crops or his animals, something he does periodically.  His dream is to have a larger stable and larger land area.

This is his second loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support.  Besides, he enjoys being part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people that he knows.  He is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan he’s asking for that will be very useful in his economic activity.

He will use the money to buy sacks of manure, fertilizers and improved seeds as well as vitamins to improve the health of his animals.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure, fertilizers and potato and pea seeds.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita T. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Lolita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is from the village of Sinara Alto in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Remedios is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Remedios plants, harvests, and sells a variety of vegetables. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Remedios joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the Remedios's fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is from the village of Santa Cruz in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Marilyn is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Marilyn plants, harvests, and sells a variety of vegetables. Marilyn is just starting this business.

In 2005, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers, such as manure. This will be Marilyn's tenth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en:
Dolorita C. is from the village of Estrella in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Dolorita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Dolorita plants, harvests, and sells a variety of vegetables. Dolorita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dolorita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolorita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa B. is 61 and resides in Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Solomon, a retiree with a pension, and the mother of six children, who are all working and settled down with their own families. By the grace of God, Narcisa has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level -- a dream for most Filipino parents like Narcisa. She was a college undergraduate and she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children. At this time, Narcisa is working hard for the family's everyday expenses

Narcisa operates a buy-and-sell business.  She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, processed foods and other products of the like. Her current products are dried fish, peanut butter and frozen goods. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 
 
Narcisa hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marivic dreams to be able to give her all her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

Phan N.’s business is getting better from day to day.  She has many customers who often come to her shop to use her services.   Chanthy is requesting a loan of $300 from Kiva through HKL to be used to buy supplies for decorating hair.

loans.use: To buy hair supplies

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle C. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 37 years old and is married.  She has three school-aged children and one infant child.

Annabelle operates a family member's business in the food sector, primarily  selling different kinds of fish in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Annabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
This is Jasmin S., 28.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Arvin S., a system analyst.  Together they have two children, both of whom are enrolled in elementary school.  They also help her in managing the household and with the business. By the grace of God, Jasmin has managed to support her children's schooling.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jasmin operates an alkaline water station. She retails drinking water to her immediate community.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales everyday.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to maintain her facilities and to pay the bills for the business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Jasmin dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian M. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 adult children. Lilian operates a family member's business in the food sector, selling different kinds of vegetables and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase vegetables and spices for her business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Lilian from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Mrs. Eam O. is a 50-year-old married woman.  She lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.  Her husband assists her in her farming business.  They have five children, two of whom are single and the other three are married. 

Mrs. Eam O. owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops such as rice and vegetables.    She planted crops over two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy many sacks of fertilizer for her crops to grow well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Cristina Jimoya's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina J. is from the barangay of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  Cristina is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cristina J.’s Group. 

Cristina is 57 years old, married to Rogelio J., and is blessed with 7 children, all of whom are now adults. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store, farming corn, and fattening hogs. Her husband is a farmer. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years. She earns an average of PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. 

On December 15, 2008, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities.  Cristina has successfully repaid a loan of  PHP 7,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 as her 5th loan, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her corn production and for motorcycle repairs. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments,  and pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, and to repair motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Ma. Marilyn V., 45.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Gilberto V..  Together they have three children, two of whom are already working, while one is still studying and staying at home managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Marilyn has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store where she also sells cooked viands and rice. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan in purchasing raw ingredients for her viands like meat, vegetables, seasonings, and other similar items. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marilyn dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita D. R., 37.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines.  At present, Nenita is working hard for her and her family’s future.

Nenita operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, and other products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Nenita hopes that her business will continue to succeed. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Mrs. Melita U. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old.  She is married to Bartolome U., who is the one managing their business. They are blessed with 4 adult children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a coco lumber business. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Melita is requesting a loan of 14,995 PHP, which will be used to buy more coconut lumber. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family and for future emergencies.



About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
This is Melita D., 56. She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Melanio D.. Together they have three children, all of whom live at home, managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Melita has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melita operates a beauty parlor where she also sells beauty supplies. People who work hard and desire pampering but despise the pricey treatment in spas are welcome to come to these little parlors to get haircuts, beautification treatments, manicures, pedicures, and much more for a fraction of their prices in spas.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Melita is requesting a Php 36,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more beauty products and supplies for her parlor like hair crèmes, oils, nail polish, and the like. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Melita hopes to have more extra capital for her business so she can start expanding soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:

Regina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Regina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long D. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offsprings and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in the cultivation of crops on her own farmland. The couple has six children, five of whom are already married and one is single. 

Mrs. Long D. has raised a lot of piglets and she hopes to sell them to buyers four months after she begins raising them. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Long D. and her family, Mrs. Long D. has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork commands the highest price.   

Note: Mrs. Long D., her husband, and her granddaughter are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mrs. Josephine L. is from the barangay of Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married to Jerito L., and blessed with 5 children, all of whom are now in college, high school, or elementary school. To make a living, she is presently employed as an insurance underwriter together with her husband as the area manager. They’re also engaged in the direct and network sales of fitness and wellness food supplements products. She has been employed for 3 years and has been in the direct and network selling business for 10 years. She earns an amount of not less than Php 10,000.00 per month from insurance sales and not less than Php 5,000.00 from their direct and network selling business.

Josephine is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, and has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 50,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php 50,000.00 as her 3rd loan, which will be used as additional working capital for the insurance premium quota and for the food supplement direct and network selling business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, their children’s education, and possible future land acquisitions.

 About PMPC:

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 years old. Rema is married and has 4 children, aged 25, 21, 19 and 17. To make a living, Rema owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rema wants to be a good wife and mother to her family.

Rema joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rema has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rema is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan H., 44.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Robert H., a retiree, and father to their child. By the grace of God, Susan has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Susan, as she herself has been a college graduate (she has a Bachelor of Science in Education) and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Susan operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell them piecemeal with a little profit.  Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, frozen foods, etc. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Susan hopes that her child will graduate soon and have a stable job. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
This is Carolyn B., 33.  She is a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Almario B., a welder.  She is the mother of two children, one in high school and the younger one in elementary school. By the grace of God, Carolyn has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send both of them all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Carolyn, as she herself has been a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Carolyn operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Juanita’s. The junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and the like. She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will incorporate the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Carolyn hopes that her business will continue to mature and be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
33-year-old Roberto farms for a living. He lives in Sto. Niño, Agusan del Sur, where agriculture is one of the main livelihoods. Roberto plants and harvests rice crops. His wife helps him sell their harvest at the market.  Roberto aims to improve his family's living conditions. texts.en:
