In 2010, Flordelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. Flordelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for her snack vending business. This will be the second loan taken out by Flordelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel W. is 43 years old and runs a motorcycle transport business popularly known as “Bodaboda” in Kenya. He is married to Jane Wacera and they have two daughters together: Winnie, who is in secondary school, and Susan, in primary school. His business is in Kiserian town, which is well populated. He has run the business for 4 years, and his monthly profit is Kshs 19,000 with no other sources of income.

Samuel was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients. This loan of Kshs 55,000 will be his first loan with KADET, and he plans to use the entire amount to purchase another motorbike. If the loan boosts the business, Samuel will develop his piece of land, which he bought previously.

Samuel's dream is to be able to build rental houses in the next 2 years. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Emily Waithira

texts.en:
Emily is 32 years old, married and has two children. For the last two years, she has made a living by running a retail shop in the Ikumbi Centre where she sells food items. In a typical month, she earns about Kshs. 8,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy sugar, rice and flour to sell to her customers. Her goal is to make enough money to start a wholesale shop, give her children a quality education and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and flour to sell to her customers

loans.name: Daina Wandia

texts.en:
Diana K. is a 40 year old single lady who has two children aged 12 and 8 years. She sells new clothes in Eldoret town though is a client in our KADET LTD Kabarnet Office. She started this business five years ago and she gets an average monthly income of Kshs 20,000.
  
She has borrowed a third loan of Kshs 85,000 which she intends to use to purchase new clothes for her boutique shop so that she is able to cater for her clients' different needs during this festive season. She anticipates using her profits to expand her business.

Her future dream is to open a wholesale clothing shop and start a cereals shop.

loans.use: Increasing her stock of clothes

loans.name: Esther Gathoni

texts.en:
Esther is 29 years married to Gabriel Macharia who contributes to the family income. They have two children. She has been knitting for about 10 years now with an income of Kshs. 7,000 per month.

This is her first loan from  KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy more knitting thread and a new machine. She hopes to open more knitting shops in the area and to manage a wholesale shop . She also hopes to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more knitting thread and a new machine.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Узбекова Малика проживает в районе Яван. Ей 38 лет. Разведена. Имеет двоих детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование среднее. После того как рассталась с мужем занялась бизнесом. В доме и на рынке Тичорат у нее имеется магазин. Она в основном продает женскую и детскую одежду. Брат и сестра помогают ей в бизнесе. Торговлей Малика занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Malika U. lives in Yavan.  She is 38 years old, divorced, and has two children.  She lives with her parents. She has a high school education.  She began her business after she left her husband.   She has a shop at home and one in the Tichorat market.  She primarily sells women’s and children's clothes.  Her brother and sister help her with the business.  Malika has been working in sales for three years now.  She is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods.

loans.use: Buying seasonal goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Treas

texts.en: Mr. K. is 40 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where he earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind his house. He raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at his house. He is married with three children, and all of them are single. His wife helps him in the business. Presently, Mr. K.’s business is going well and he wants to add more funds to purchase some feed and small ducks to raise. That is why Mr. K. has applied for a $1,200 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: To purchase some feed and small ducks to raise

loans.name: Peris  Khavayi

texts.en:
Peris Khavayi S. is 42 years old, married to Joseph Khavayi who is a businessman and this also is a source of additional income for the family. They have four children in school of age 21 years, 20 years, 18 years, and 14 years respectively, there residential place is in Lodwar-Kenya. She has been operating an Hotel and has been in this business for nine years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs.30,000.

Peris learned about KADET LTD through Credit officer and so she is applying for her first loan of Kshs.50,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to buy  100 liters of cooking oil, two bags of sugar and five bundles of baking flour. With the anticipated profits, she plans to buy equipment to help her bake cakes for birthdays and weddings.

In the future, Peris wishes to live a better and more comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: To buy 100 liters of cooking oil, two  bags of sugar and five bundles of baking flour.

loans.name: Julieven

texts.en:
Julieve Manawan is 21 years of age, married, and a resident of Bocator, Tangub City. For her source of income, she operates a sari-sari store business. For two years, she was able to maintain her business even in hard times.  Julieve is presently earning an average net income of about 3,000 PHP,  which is very helpful for herself and her close relatives.

Julieve joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she is very interested in its products and services.  PAGLAUM MPC is one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and was awarded for being the most outstanding cooperative in the Philippines by the COOP-LGU Partnership in 2006. As a newly recognized member, Julieve was able to borrow  3,000 PHP, which she used  to add to her capital for her existing sari-sari store business. The future income from this business will be used for her daily basic needs, loan repayments, and savings for the future. She is hoping that someday she will be able to expand her little stall.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To acquire additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Felecidad

texts.en:
Felecidad P. is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub City. Felecidad is engaged in fish vending and has been doing so for six years.  She earns an average net income of approximately 3,000 PHP a month. She joined PAGLAUM MPC a few years ago. She was given a loan of 10,000 PHP, which is her sixth loan loan, to acquire capital for her business. The future income will be used to meet the family's daily needs and savings. She is hoping that through this business she will be able to send her children to school. PAGLAUM MPC is one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and was awarded for being Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award in 2006 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To acquire additional capital for fish selling

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Phum M. is 45 years old and generates a daily income of $1.50 per day by selling fish.  She is married to Seang Yan who is 33 years old and he works as a construction worker as well as a fisherman in and around the Phnom Penh City of Cambodia.  He earns approximately $2.50 each day to support the family's expenses. 

They have four children who go to the local public school.  This approaching fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but her husband is lacking tools to fish with. Therefore, Phum M. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support his business activities.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 23 years old supporting a family of three members. He is married to Emily Chemwotei and together they have two children aged 5 years and 3 years. He does farming and he has been in business for four years and right now his monthly income from the business is Kshs 5,000.

He has now borrowed Kshs 20,000 which he is planning to use to purchase goats and open a butchery where he will be selling meat. He plans to use the anticipated profits from the business will be used to purchase more goats for slaughter and to expand the business. This is his third loan and he paid his previous loan successfully. 

Benson hopes are to have a satisfying business in life and to start a business for his spouse.

loans.use: To purchase more goats and open a butchery.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.ru:
Kamil M. 20 let. On ne jenat i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Kamil okonchil shkolu i nachal rabotat , on uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya pereprodajey odejdi. Kamil ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i dovolen yeyu.

Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye , postavit polki dlya raskladki odejdi. Kamil v dalneyshem xotel bi pradovat ne toka jenskuyu no i mujskuyu odejdu.
texts.en:
Kamil M. is twenty years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the Absheron region.  Kamil graduated from school and started working. He has been selling clothes for two years already.  He really loves his work and is satisfied doing it.

Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to expand his shop and to install shelves to hold clothes.  In the future, Kamil would like to sell not only women’s clothing, but men’s as well.

loans.use: Expand his shop

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Шохфайзов Махмадали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается растениеводством. Имеет большой участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для закупа семян и вспашки земли.
texts.en: Mahmadali S. lives in Yavan.  He is 56 years old, married, and has five children.  He has a high school education.  He works in agriculture.  He has a large plot where he sows wheat and grows vegetables.  He has a great deal of experience in this.  He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and to get his land plowed.

loans.use: buying seeds and getting his land plowed.

loans.name: Deth

texts.en:
Deth T. presently earns her income by weaving bamboo baskets at her house for sale.  She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house.  She makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out.  She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. 

Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weaves baskets.  Recently, Deth T. also became a domestic rice trader.  She buys rice in bulk from people who live in the village and then she stores the rice in her stock supply in order to sell it to gain at a profit.  Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Deth T. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is higher.

loans.use: To buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is higher.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business and purchase the vegetable and fruits which are not available in his shop.

loans.name: Jonathan Kimanzi

texts.en:
Jonathan is 31 years old and married to Kambua who contributes to the family income. He has been using a motorcycle for transport business for the past eight years with an income of about Kshs. 2,000 per month.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD which he intends to use to buy another motorbike so that he can be able to get more clients and more profits. He will employ someone else to offer the services on the other motorbike. 

He hopes to one day own a fleet of motorcycles and Lorries for transport.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transport.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 42 years old and is married to Damaris Wangechi, who is a farmer. They have three children and support two other members of their family. James has a two-year-old motorcycle business that generates an income of about 38,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

This is his second loan after clearing his previous loan successfully. He wants to use the loan to start a poultry farm to add more income for his family. He hopes to expand this poultry farm in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn F. is 34 years old, married, and has two adult children. Marilyn engages in the business of buying and selling pigs in their area in Bocator, Tangub City.  She has been in this business for five years and she earns an average net income of approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Marilyn joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she is very interested in its products and services. She is applying for a loan for 4,000 PHP, which is her first loan.  She will use the loan to purchase more pigs to sell. Marilyn wishes to expand their market to other cities and even to other countries someday. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Benedeta  Mutindi

texts.en:
For the last five years Benedeta has been selling cereals in Ndunyu Njeru town.She is 47 years old and is married to Justus Nganga. 

She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. This will be her third loan and she has no history with any other MFI. She paid her previous loan of Kshs. 20,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to boost her stock and also buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for farm labour that she operates besides her cereal shop.

In the future, Benedeta hopes to open a whole store for cereals.

loans.use: To boost her stock and also buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for farm labour that she operates besides her cereal shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Ntito  Ene

texts.en:
Ntito has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last 10 years. She is 32 years old, married to Lokongo Ole K.. They have two children in school.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy five cows which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Ntito hopes to open a wholesale store for selling skin and hides.

loans.use: To buy five cows to rear and sell at a profit.

loans.name: Yu

texts.en: Yu S., 36, is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase equipment for his dental care business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. S. is a dentist, earning an income of USD 15 per day. He is single and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. He spends USD 35 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy equipment to improve his dental care business

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Norng S., 45, is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase cows to help plow her rice fields. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. S. is a farmer who raises animals, earning an income of USD 2 per day. She is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-ankorean temples. The family spends USD 30 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy cows to help plow her rice field

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget K., 36, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase duck eggs to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. K. and her husband purchase duck eggs to resell, earning an income of USD 12 per day. Khem is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-ankorean temples. The family spends USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy duck eggs to resell

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en: Rogers is a 68 years old and married.  He lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he wants to set up a farm for his family. He has been in the tea planting business for 20 years and the business is continuously reaping tangible benefits. Rogers needs the loan to plant tea.

loans.use: To plant tea

loans.name: Nub

texts.en: Nub K. is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She and her family live in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area knows for pre-ankorean temples.  K. sells food and coffee, earning $6 per day. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more food to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. The family has to spend $30 on food, $15 on electricity supply, and $30 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials for his shop

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S. is 34 years old, married, and has three children.  The family lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-ankorean temples.  She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. S. is a farmer and raises animals, earning an income of $2.50 per day. One of her children is employed as a construction worker, earning $3.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend $55 on food, $10 on electricity supply, and $23 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Bakristo Kweterana Group-Ibanda

texts.en: 42 year old John T. has been in the dairy business for the last 13 years in Burunga-Ibanda. It is a business he says he inherited from his parents who he says passed onto him the spirit of diligence and dynamism. These have been virtues he has relied on to make his business a success. John who is happily married with 3 kids says savings from his teaching job have come in handy in helping him solidify and consolidate his business earnings. John also sells cows as a means of supplementing on his profits. Monthly his business profits are to the tune of shillings 450,000 and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more cows. Alice, the lady standing next to John, mistakenly put up her arm too when the photo was being taken.

loans.use: The purchase of more cows

loans.name: Kheav

texts.en: Kheav K. is a 50-year-old married woman who has been living in Kompong Tom Province. Kheav K. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandparent. She and her husband grow rice crops and cashews, which they will sell to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. The couple has six children, four of whom are single, and the remaining two are married. They have had great success growing cashews, which is an annual process. For earning more profit, Kheav K. would like to request a loan as capital to buy more cashew seeds for ongoing planting.

loans.use: To buy more cashew seeds to plant

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 28 year old married man with a child, living in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to buy land for the family. He deals in a number of businesses such as poultry keeping, a retail shop, and motorcycle transport. Joshua needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Iftikhar

texts.ru:
Iftikhar A. 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey sin kotoromu 6 let on xodit v shkolu i doch kotoroy 3 qoda. Iftikhar i yeqo semya jivut Absheron regione  uje 7 let.

Iftikhar uje 6 let kak yavlyayetsya elektrik injenerom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy toje bil elektrikom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya svoyey raboti.
texts.en: Iftikhar A. is 32 years. He is married and has two children: a 6-year old son, who is in school, and a 3-year old daughter. Iftikhar and his family have been living in the Absheron Region for 7 years. Iftikhar has been working as an electrical engineer for six years. He learned this trade from his father, who also used to be an electrician. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase tools for his work.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary new tools

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 42 year old single mother of a child, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a dream of building a permanent house in the future. For 6 years, she has been operating a retail shop. The business has enabled her to educate her child, but she is faced with a challenge of limited capital to meet the demands of her customers. Joyce needs the loan to buy  soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Margaret Mumbe

texts.en:
Margaret Mumbe M. is 47 years old business lady who owns and teaches in her private school in Kilifi. She is a single mother of four children. Margaret has been in the education sector for one year and her business is doing well and she has been able see the number of her pupils grow for that one year.


This marks Margaret's first loan from KADET and she plans to purchase desks for her pupils. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to build a new classroom.


She has dreams of expanding the school to an academy that she hopes will be a centre of excellence in future.

loans.use: purchase desks for the students

loans.name: Lily's Group

texts.en:
Lily B. is from the city of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old. Lily is the group leader for a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lily is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lily owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Lily has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Lily is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Lily's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 29 years old and married, with two children who are nine months and three years old. Her husband works as a teacher. Angelique has been raising chickens for three years and employs one other person.

Angelique has requested a loan to purchase more chickens to raise and with the loan and the additional business it brings, she hopes to provide enough food for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand B. C. is a 55 year old man who is married to Clerice Mbodza (a business woman) and they are blessed with three children. Ferdinand has operated his hotel business for the last six years. With his business he has been able to cater for all his family’s needs and, for this, he is grateful to God.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTS and he plans to purchase more items of cutlery for the hotel. He knows that, especially in the festive season, he will get a large number of customers and he does not want to suffer the embarrassment of not having enough cutlery to serve his customers. He hopes to use the profits to pay school fees for his grandchild’s education.

He hopes that his business will grow to become great.

loans.use: To purchase cutlery for the hotel

loans.name: Malinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Malinda L. is 39 years old and married. She is a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. She and her husband have been blessed with eight children who are now teenagers. Her husband is a driver of motorcycles for hire with an average net income of not less than P150 a day. To help her husband in raising their children, she decided to start a business, and opened up a little dried fish-selling shop in their barangay. For a year, she has been able to maintain this business and has been able to purchase stock for her business. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than P1500 a month, which amount is very helpful for their family.

She joined PAGLAUM MPC two years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a first-time borrower with an excellent credit record, she was allowed to borrow the amount of P4000 to add to her capital for her existing dried fish business. The future income from this loan will be used for loan repayments, daily basic needs and savings for the future use of their child.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Reoun

texts.en: Reoun S., 31, is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profits to repair his house. S. is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day. S. is married and resides with his wife and a child in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment factory industry. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Kipekera Group

texts.en:
M. M. is in his early twenties and is single with no children. He has owned a charcoal business for one year. He works from 6.00am to 6.00pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be M.'s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his first loan to increase his charcoal stock and has paid back this loan successfully.  He hopes to obtain a new loan with which he will use to open a fruit and vegetable business. His dream is to buy land on which to build his own home.

M. will share his loan with his loan group K., which has a total of 18 members.  The members of the group will help each other to pay back the loan.

In the photo, M. is in front wearing a green T-shirt.

loans.use: To open a fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 46-year-old widow with six children. She runs a food kiosk in the Kamali area. She has been in the business for the last two years with an income of 4,000 KES a month.

She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD to buy more stock of tea leaves, milk, flour, maize and beans in order to increase her food production. She hopes that the increase will also enable her to prepare more ethnic dishes, which are her customer’s favorites.

She hopes to educate her children to the highest level, expand her business, and improve the living standard of her children.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, milk, flour, maize and beans

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 53, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. S. is a housewife; she is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment factory industry. The four children are all employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 15 on electricity, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en:
Frederic is 45 years old. He is married and has 6 children aged between 7 and 20.  Frederic has 10 years in his business selling different goods in his general store. He employs two people and his business is open from 6am until 8pm.  

Frederic has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business. With this loan, Frederic believes he will obtain more profit in goods distribution, which he will reinvest in his business. He hopes for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase more products and items to sell

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en:
Marionito A. is from the village of Kinangay Sur Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Marionito is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marionito owns and operates a transportation services business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Marionito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marionito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marionito has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Marionito is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP that will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marionito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok M., 45, is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family use. M. is a navy soldier, earning an income of 7 USD per day. M. is married and resides with his wife and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for the garment factory industry. The family has to spend 70 USD on food, 20 USD on electricity, and 60 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. M. appears in the photograph with his wife. In the future, M. would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old and is married to Leah Njeri who helps with the farm. He has a tea plantation and also a dairy farm. John has been growing tea for the past 3 years with an income of 15,000 KES per month.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use it to buy a dairy goat for commercial purposes. He hopes to venture into greenhouse farming and keep more dairy animals in order to train others.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Kuy B., 39, is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profits to repair his house. B. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 8 per day. B. is married and lives with his wife and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment factory industry. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married, with a son and a daughter. He is a farmer in the town of Vodyanoye, in a predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine. There are very few employment options there, which is why many people in town are struggling to survive. Viktor was one of them, but he managed to launch a small agricultural venture 16 years ago. Since then, his greenhouse business has grown and expanded to a scale Viktor couldn’t even think of. Currently, Viktor owns four spacious greenhouses. He plants 5,000 tomatoes every year. He has 52,000 Grivnyas invested in this business.

Viktor is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase tomato seeds. Last year Viktor tried planting tall-grown tomatoes and was very satisfied with quality and quantity of his harvest. Therefore, he is hoping to plant solely tall-grown tomatoes this farming season, thus ensuring a stable income for himself and his family. Viktor is hoping to save some money and reinvest it in much-needed reconstruction of two of his greenhouses that are old and need to be refurbished.

loans.use: To purchase tall-grown tomato seeds.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 40 years old and is married, with four children aged between seven and fourteen years old. Her husband works in construction. Bernadette has been farming cows for four years and employs two people to help her manage the business.

Bernadette has requested a loan to renovate her house. She plans to reinvest any profits she makes from her business and she would also like to save for the future.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Rovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Rovelyn U., from the town of Eastern Pob.Lopez Jaena, is 31 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of her fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

A married mother of one school-aged child, Rovelyn owns and operates a fishing business harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 900 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting her second loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Rovelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital for her newly opened sari-sari store

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with an adult daughter, Alyona. Nadezhda is a farmer from an agricultural region of Ukraine. She grows early spring vegetables, i.e. tomatoes, radishes, peppers, cucumbers, etc. Nadezhda owns six greenhouses for vegetables and two additional ones for seedlings. Every year she grows 8,000 tomatoes alone. 

Nadezhda is an experienced entrepreneur and farmer. She has been working in this field for 27 years. She has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in her enterprise. Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and polyethylene film for her greenhouses. In addition, she is hoping to use a portion of the loan as investment in a heating system and dripping irrigation units.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, polyethylene film and install heating and dripping units.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S. is a 34-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with six kids, two are unmarried and the other four are married. Her husband, Bun Heang, works in the farming business. Long S. inherited the farmland from her grandmother, and she grows different kinds of crops on it. She and her husband always use their plowing machine to help them in the farming business. Presently, Long S. is applying for this loan to buy gasoline for putting in her plowing machine in order to continue plowing, and the rest of fund use for purchasing a few fertilizers for her crop growing well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for putting in plowing machine.

loans.name: Rose Aduvukha

texts.en:
Rose Aduvukha M. is 39 years old, single mother. She has one school-going child of age 15years old, her residence is in Lodwar- Kenya. She operates a food stall and has been in this business for one year and earns a monthly profit of Kshs.29,500.

Rose learned about KADET LTD through Credit officer and so she is applying for her first loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to buy 10 crates of soda and three bags of Irish potatoes. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand the business and change to real hotel. 

In the future, Rose wishes to have different branches of hotels in different towns. Her deeper desire is to see her son realize his goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 10 crates of soda and 3 bags of Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev R., 40 years-old, is requesting a loan of US $1,000 in order to purchase electronic equipment for one of her children to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. R. is a housewife and her husband is a driver for a private company, earning an income of US $5 per day. 

R. is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for the garment factory industry. The family has to spend US $120 on food, US$ 20 on electricity supply, and US$ 30 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase electronic equipment to start a business.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 33 years-old and is married with three children aged between four and 17 years-old.  He also takes care of one orphan who is 14 years-old. Denis has eight years experience selling seeds for Irish potatoes. He employs four people and his business is open from 7am until 4pm every day except on Saturday. 

Denis has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company to purchase more equipment and other stock.  He would like to own a small shop one day if he can make enough profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for a farm seedling business.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong N., 45 years-old, is requesting a loan of US$ 900 to purchase shoes to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. 

N. sells shoes, earning an income of US$ 3 per day. N. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for the garment factory industry. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of US$ 5 per day to help cover family expenses. The family has to spend US$ 75 on food, US$ 10 on electricity supply, and US$ 20 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
60-year-old Corazon G. is from the town of Banga. She is now a widow and supports her children all by herself. She owns and manages a farm where rice and corn crops are planted. She also grows pigs for fattening. She sells her harvest and fattened pigs to the market. Corazon does her best to provide for her family.

Corazon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP that will be used to buy farm fertilizers and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Colombus

texts.en: 28 year old Colombus R. is a courteous, hard working and good natured business man. For the last 10 years he has been selling bananas in Kanywambogo Market-Ibanda. Before that he was selling mostly goats. Colombus is happily married and has 1 child.  To supplement his 180,000 monthly profits, he also sells goats. With this loan, Colombus says he is going to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 49 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of 13 and 30. She also takes care of two dependents. Esperance has a small retail store selling a wide variety of goods.  She has been in this business for about two years and the hours of her business are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Esperance will use this loan to purchase more cosmetic goods to sell. Any profits she makes will allow her to continue taking care of her children as well as her two dependents. In addition, she will start to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic goods like body lotion, toothpaste, and soap

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 30 years old. She's a single mother with one son. She has a green grocery store where she specialises in selling raw bananas. She has been in the business for two years and earns an income of about Kshs. 27,800 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to buy more bananas from Kisii town which is very well known to produce high quality bananas. She hopes to expand her business and become a leading banana supplier in the area, give her son a quality education, and have a better life in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas and pay for transportation from Kisii to Thika.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Roeun C. is a girl who presently lives with her family in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She is a sewing worker in private factory which is located in her province. She supports her family's daily expenses with her monthly salary. Roeun C. has 2 years experience in this sector. Previous repairs have been made on Roeun C.’s house, but now she lacks cash to pay for construction fees. To clear this problem, Roeun C. would like to borrow some funds to add with her personal savings to pay for construction costs.

loans.use: To pay for construction cost.

loans.name: Margaret Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years old. She is married to Harrison Thuo, who contributes to the family's income.They have three dependent children. Margaret has been knitting pullovers for about two years now and gets a monthly income of about Kshs.11,000.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD which she intends to use to buy more buttons and thread for knitting. She hopes to have more knitting stalls, give her children a quality education, and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy more buttons and knitting thread

loans.name: 10-11-04 Group

texts.en:
Nam N. T. is a 53 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Nam is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04-Dong Son (10.13.04).


Nam is married and has 1 adult-aged child.  To making a living, Nam owns and operates a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling poultry products in the local community.  Nam has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,100,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Nam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nam is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Nam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Bich is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


2.  P. T. Toan is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  N. T. Nga is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


4.  N. T. Mai is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  N. T. Chuan is a 62 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


6.  N. T. Dung is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


7.  N. T. Hieu is a 55 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nam N. T. (33) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Nam là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04-Dong Son (10.13.04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ thịt gia cầm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nam thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nam kiếm được khoảng 2.100.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nam đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nam đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Bich (12) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  P. T. Toan (13) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  N. T. Nga (14) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4.  N. T. Mai (15) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  N. T. Chuan (16) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


6.  N. T. Dung (20) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


7.  N. T. Hieu (21) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Venny

texts.en: Venny is a 40-year-old ambitious woman, married with four children, living in her own house in Fort Portal Uganda. Vinny's desire is to have an educated, model family. She trades in produce and has been in business for 4 years. The venture has been worth her effort. Her dream is to set up a store. Venny needs this loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
Sen N. T. is 58 years old and lives in the town of Thanh Hoa. She leads a five-member loan group that's affiliated with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this loan group is Dong Son.

Sen is married, has one child and makes a living by running a store where she sells beverages such as beer and wine. She has worked in this field for more tH. two years and earns about 2,100,000 VND a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Sen joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 4.248.000 VND, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income generated by this loan to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  L. T. Hop is 44 years old and requesting a loan for 4,248,000 VND to support her business, a stall where she sells food.
2.  T. T. Lien is a 39-year-old woman who is applying for a 4,248,000 VND loan to operate her retail store.
3.  H. T. Anh Thuong is 35 years old and applying for a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her food stall.
4.  H. T. Mui is 31 years old and is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) aims to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Sen N. T. (7) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Sen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Dong Son (10.11.02).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán loại thức uống có cồn như bia & rượu trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Sen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sen kiếm được khoảng 2.100.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Sen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Hop (8) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  T. T. L:ien (9) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  H. T. Anh Thuong (10) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  H. T. Mui (11) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to expand several small retail businesses

loans.name: Abiyunze Group

texts.fr: Jean Damascene M. est commerçant, et il est un membre du groupe Abiyunze.  Il a 25 ans, il est marie, et il a 2 enfants entre 10 mois et 3 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 6eme primaire, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 poules pour son commerce.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’augmentation de l’activité.  Il voudrait devenir grand commerçant, et distributeur aux autres.  Il voudrait aussi assurer le bien être de sa famille, et s’autofinancer.
texts.en: Jean Damascene M. is a shopkeeper, and he is a member of the Abiyunze group. He is 25 years old, married, and has two children whose ages vary between 10 months and 3 years. He studied up to the 6th grade in primary school, and he is going to use his loan to buy 60 hens for his business. His strategy to raise his sales is to increase his business. He would like to become a large retailer and distribute goods to others. He would also like to ensure the well-being of his family and to be self-financing.

loans.use: To buy 60 hens for his business.

loans.name: Obedi

texts.en: Obedi is 26 years old and lives with his family in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he hopes to build his own home over the next three years. For the last six years, he has made a living by providing transportation services. Things have gone very well, but he does not own the motorcycle he drives and therefore has to give 70 percent of his income to the owner. He is applying for this loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Yves

texts.en:
Yves is 36 years old, married and has two children who are one and three years old. He makes a living by running a shop which he also owns called Camera and Photo Designs. He makes a living by charging customers for the use of cameras and printing equipment. He currently has two employees.

He plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand his business by buying more cameras.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more cameras

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is 63 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build his own home and buy a mini-bus he can use as a taxi. Currently, he makes a living by farming and providing transportation services. He has applied for this loan to help achieve his dream of buying a mini-bus.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle he can use to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 40 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 12 to 19. She is determined to increase the profitability of her business, a small boutique where she sells shoes, soaps and cosmetics. She has been running her business for four years, and works every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Marie Claire has applied for a loan to expand her business by buying more products to sell to her customers. She believes this loan will allow her to meet that goal by attracting new customers and meet her goals.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more products to sell

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun V., 45, is a busy woman who earns money from various ventures. She cultivates rice in the Province of Kompong Chhnang. She buys when rice is at the lowest price and then resells it to gain income. 

She is a widowed mother who has given birth to three children. All of her children are unmarried and working in various occupations. They share their salary with Soeun V. to manage the whole expenses in the family. Soeun V. believes that during the rice harvesting season she requires capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will resell them when rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita N. is from the village of Canibungan Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years-old. Carmelita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Carmelita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 21st loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is a 46-year-old woman who is married to Lawrence, a 50-year-old drive). They are blessed with 7 children, ages 21, 16, 14, 12, 8, 7 and 5 years. She has been selling clothes and housewares for 6 months and she manages to earn a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000/= (10000 Kenyan shillings). She also gets support from her husband’s income from driving, which enables her to meet the family expenses. 

This is her first loan from Kadet Ltd. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who benefited from our loans. With this loan, she plans to add some more household wares which include plastic items like buckets and bowls, and to add shoes to her clothing business. This will bring in more income, especially now that the holidays have set in. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and venture into farming.

Her future dream is to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To purchase plastics and school shoes

loans.name: Raphael Kagonye

texts.en:
Raphael is 38 years old. He is married to Ruth and they have four children. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for about five years and earns an income of approx Kshs. 12,000 per month.

He is applying for a second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the first one. He intends to use the loan funds to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He to use the anticipated profit to expand his business by adding more motocycles. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is a 60 year-old hardworking single mother of two living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Her dream is to build a permanent house to stay in in her old age .She is in the transport sector and owns a motorcycle although her dream is to have at least five motorcycles in business.Jalia needs the loan in order to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert K., aged 52, years sells timber at Githurai 45 and also has a carpentry shop at the same place. He is married with four children. He has been running this business for a period of 20 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 15,000.

He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office. This loan of Kshs 50000 is Robert’s first loan with KADET and he intends to increase the stock of timber in his yard for resale. If the loan boosts the business, Robert will increase his stocks again to grow his business.

Roberts hopes to expand his business to enable himself to comfortably pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Buy more timber for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is a 40-year-old widow who runs a tailoring shop as her primary business.  She also has a mobile phone money transfer shop popularly known as 'Mpesa' in Kenya, and she sells hair products. She has three children: Pauline is 22 years old and employed, Denis (age 15) and Ken (age 13) are both in school. Mary has been running this business for 4 years, and she gets a monthly profit of 21,000 Kenyan Shillings which she uses to support her family and pay school fees for her children. She has an extra income from some houses she has rented out. You can thus refer to her as a Jack of all trades.

She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Thika Road office. This will be Mary's second loan with KADET, and she wants to use 30000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more fabrics for stitching and 40000 Kenyan Shillings to increase the float in her money transfer business. If the loan boosts the business, Mary plans to open a bigger workshop and purchase sewing machines instead of outsourcing the stitching services.

Mary hopes to educate her sons to university level to help them be self-sufficient.

loans.use: To add capital to her mobile money transfer business and fabric for making dresses

loans.name: 16-02-10 Group

texts.en:
Hue N. T. (8) is a 41 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hue is the group leader of a six member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 10-Dong hai (16.02.10).

Hue is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, Hue owns and operates a fishing business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Hue has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hue joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hue is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in the amount of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  Hue plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  B. T. Phien (39) is a 56 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

2.  L. T. lan (33) is a 58 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  N. T. Phuong (32) is a 36 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

4.  N. T. Tuyen (70) is a 29 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

5.  L. T. Nga (4) is a 48 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hue N. T. (8) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hue là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 10-Dong hai (16.02.10).

Vào 2010, Hue đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hue đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  B. T. Phien (39) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  L. T. lan (33) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. T. Phuong (32) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  N. T. Tuyen (70) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  L. T. Nga (4) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ann Wanjiru

texts.en:
Ann has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. She is 38 years old and married to Benson Ng’ero. They are blessed with three children, all of which go to school.

She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer from KADET's Ndunyu Njeru office, and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan of 35,000 kshs in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to pay for fertilizer, seedlings, and labour.

In the future she hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, seedlings and labour

loans.name: Gorden

texts.en: Thirty-five-year-old M. Gorden got involved in his current banana sells trade in Kanywambogo-Ibanda through savings from his earlier agro produce and retail trades. This business has now lasted a decade. He mostly relies on harvests from his own gardens. The happily married father of 5 says he has steadily been making progress in regards to establishing a strong footing and position for his business in the local markets. He says this business generates him 220,000 UGX monthly and with this loan, he is anticipating purchasing more farm inputs.

loans.use: The purchase of more farm inputs

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is 35 years-old and married with three children.  He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda and has the aspiration to educate his children. He deals in spare parts and has been in business for six years.  His dream is to have at least four shops as the venture is very profitable. Steven needs the loan in order to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is 42 years old. She is married to Joseph, who also contributes to the family income. She runs a grocery shop which has been in existence for the past 2 years. She has been making a profit of about 3,000 KES per month.

This is her fourth loan with KADET, after successfully repaying the previous loans. She plans to use the loan to add more stock of cabbage, kale and tomatoes to her green grocery shop. 

She hopes to be a leading business lady by opening more stores and giving her children a quality education, as well as improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy bags of cabagges, kales and tomatoes

loans.name: Hezekiel Kibunja

texts.en:
Hezekiel is 35 years old and married to Ruth Wangui, who contributes towards the family income. They have three children. He has been running a horticulture farm for a period of 5 years, with an income of about 3,000 KES per month. 

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy fertilizer and manure for his farm in order to increase productivity. He hopes to be a leading farmer and give his children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Dhoren

texts.en:
Dhoren F. is from the town of Banga. She is 25 years old. Dhoren is married and has a 6-year-old child. To make a living, Dhoren owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dhoren also makes puto (rice cakes) and other delicacies, which she sells around her neighborhood.

Dhoren joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dhoren has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dhoren is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy K., 45, stitches materials to make dresses at Kahawa Sukari Estate. She is married to Mugera; together they have two children aged 21 years and 13 years. She has been running this business for a period of 11 years and her monthly profit is Kshs 20,000.

She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office. This loan of Kshs 50,000 is Lucy’s third loan with KADET. With the loan, Lucy will buy more materials for the business. If the loan boosts the business, Lucy plans to open another branch and employ seamstresses.

Lucy hopes to build an empire of business to help her family live comfortably.

loans.use: To purchase material for making dress designs.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Making baskets is a part of 55-year-old Touch N.’s daily routine. Touch N. and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell around her community. They also buy baskets from other weavers and sell them at a profit. They have done this since 1985. Touch N. is an older mother who has two children who live in their own homes.
