She was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients. This loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings is her second loan from KADET, and she intends to buy iron sheets to renovate her hotel and buy uniforms for the employees. If the loan boosts the business, she will build a big hotel and educate her children to high levels.

Syprose dreams of having hotels in the city centre and other parts of the country. She describes herself as honest, and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets to renovate her hotel and buy uniforms for her employees.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard T. is 58 years old and is married with 8 children. He has a beer depot in Kawaruju trading center and his customers are mostly bars and retail shops. He is able to make 40,000 in weekly profits in addition to the income he obtains from agriculture and rentals. This is a self initiated business and he needs a loan to be able to buy more beer for resale.

loans.use: To buy more beer for resale.

loans.name: Ruth Wangari

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and is married to Joseph, who also contributes to their family income. They have three children. She runs a business selling sand for construction. This is very marketable in Kenya as many people invest in the construction of rental houses. She has been in the business for three years and earns an income of about 15,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

This is her second loan from KADET after successfully repaying her previous loan. She hopes to be a leading sand supplier to give her children a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To acquire more sand for her business.

loans.name: Jackline Ngina

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman of 37 years old and the mother of four children. They live in Muumandu in Makueni. She sells clothes and also operates a general shop where she sells food items like maize, beans, and wheat. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the last six years. 

She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to add cereals to sell in her retail shop so that, in this festive season, she can maximize on her returns.

loans.use: Jackline wants to buy beans and cereals for her retail shop.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida M. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old. Zenaida is married and has 4 children. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice crops. Her husband, who is also a farmer, does the major farming duties while Zenaida manages their sari-sari store. Zenaida works hard to give her family better living conditions.

Zenaida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Bénète Plus Group

texts.en:
Ngoyi K. is the leader of the Community Bank group named "Bénète Plus." It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Ngoyi is 43 years old and the mother of five children whose ages vary between 10 and 20 years old. All of them go to school. She has been active in her business since 2006 when she began running a drugstore. She joined one of Hope’s groups (a Democratic Republic of the Congo Microfinance Program) in 2009, and has received six loans since. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Ngoyi has diversified her business by adding the sale of corn flour and semolina. Her business has prospered and it generates a profit of $73 per week. With this loan, Ngoyi intends to increase the inventory of her business by buying some sacks of corn flour and semolina to meet her customers' needs and increase her income. Her ambition is to become a corn flour and semolina provider in her community. She works hard in order to achieve her dream.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her goods by buying more corn flour and semolina and reselling them at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee B. is from the town of Banga. She is 23 years old and single. For a living, Aimee owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Aimee hopes to grow her business so she can continue helping her family financially and save for the future.

Aimee joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Aimee has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Aimee is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase seed and fertilizer. She plans to use additional revenue generated from her business to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony B. is from the town of Banga. He is 31 years old and married. To make a living, Anthony owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Anthony wants to have children so he works hard to have savings for the future.

Anthony joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Anthony has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. Cecilia is married and has two children, ages 12 and 9. Her wish is for her children to finish college and have bright futures. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Cecilia is just starting this business.

Cecilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds.

loans.name: Herma

texts.en:
Herma B. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old. Herma is married and has two children ages 15 and 2. To make a living, Herma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Herma wishes to have a successful business.

Herma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Herma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Herma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a young man from Tulkarem City. Haitham is a police man. Haitham started furnishing his house and he had to borrow $1,100 from friends and relatives to finish furnishing. Haitham came to FATEN and took a loan to pay back his friends and relatives.

Haitham is a an ambitious man and a very good reputation police man. Haitham appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To pay for house furniture expenses

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie D. J. is from the town of Banga. He is 35 years old. Jessie is single. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jessie also tills farm land where he plants and harvests rice crops. Jessie wishes to have his own family someday.

Jessie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy feeds, vitamins and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy feeds, vitamins and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Julius Waweru

texts.en:
Julius is 30 years old and married to Susan Wambui, who contributes to the family income.  They have two children. He runs a timber business which he has been running for about six years with a profit of approximately Kshs. 8,000 per month.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. He hopes to be a leading timber trader and give his children a quality education and improve their living standards

loans.use: To buy more timber for sale.

loans.name: Yesu Ammala Kamwokya-Kampala Group

texts.en: 60 year old Tedora K. belongs to Yesu Ammala Kamwokya Group-Kampala. She has been running her rentals business in Kamwokya for 30 years. The rentals were constructed with savings from her retail enterprise transactions. Tedora says honesty and being steadfast and determined are all factors that have been momentous to her as she operates. Her retail shop is still in existence, but her focus is now on the rentals. Monthly, her profits are to the tune of 1,000,000 Shillings. Tedora is happily married with five kids and she says with this loan she is going to renovate her rental structures.

loans.use: To renovate her rental structures.

loans.name: Petrosyan

texts.en: M. Petrosyan is 31 years old. She lives in Ijevan with her husband and 3 children. Since her youngest child is only a year old, M. doesn’t work away from home, but instead she engages in land cultivation and swine breeding in their yard; she also grows walnuts. M. says swine breeding is a profitable business, so she would like to develop her farm and is asking for a 800,000 AMD loan to buy two sows and fodder. The sows will give her piglets which she will be able to sell next year. This is Mari's 4th loan from Nor Horizon and she has never had any delayed payments.

loans.use: To buy two sows and fodder.

loans.name: Factory Youth Development Association Group

texts.en: T. Zainabu has a retail shop in Butogota Upper that sells sugar, drinks and salt. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 children above 4-years-old.  Her customers are mostly local people and travelers. She makes 200,000 UGX in monthly profits and gets an extra income from farming. She is very hard working and needs the loan to buy more stock for her shop since there is a ready market for the festive season and the seasons to follow.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop.

loans.name: Susan Nyambura

texts.en:
Susan is 34 years and is married to Dominic G., who also contributes to their family income. They have three children and she has been running her retail shop for a period of one year with a profit of about Kshs. 9,000 per month.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD after she successfully repaid the previous ones. She plans to use the loan to add more stock of dry goods like flour, rice and sugar. She hopes to be a leading wholesale trader, give her children a quality education, and improve their living standards in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock of flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Torrent De Kerith Plus Group

texts.en:
Patrick T. is the leader of a community bank named “Torrent de Kerith Plus”, which is composed of 14 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Patrick 28, married, runs a cellphone booth. He has been in business since 2007. With hard work and good management, He has been capable of diversifying his business by adding prepaid cards and telephone accessories to resell in order to increase his working capital. He makes a profit of about $25 per week. Patrick’s ambition is to become a prepaid cards provider in his area. As he wants to develop his business, he then decided to join one of Hope’s groups in January 2010. He is planning with the next loan to purchase dozens of prepaid cards and resell them at profit. Patrick has an eight years daughter who attends school.

loans.use: To purchase dozens of prepaid cards and phone accessories to resell in order to increase the working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Patrick Kuya

texts.en:
Patrick Kuya, aged 33 years, runs a cereals shop at Kware Estate, which is a well populated semi-slum area. He is married to Christine Kuya and together they have one daughter, Belinda, aged six years in preschool. He was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Patrick has been running this business for a period of two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. This loan of Kshs 10,000 is his second loan from KADET. He intends to use the loan to increase stocks of green gram in his cereals shop. If the loan boosts the business, he plan to use the profit to add his stock to make his shop a wholesale.

Patrick’s future dream is to open a wholesale shop and to educate his child. he describes himself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stock of green gram in his cereals shop

loans.name: Samuel Nyoike

texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old and married to Lucy Wanjiku, who contributes to the family income. They have four children. Samuel is a tailor and he has been running the business for a period of three years with an income of Kshs. 12,000 per month.

This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. He hopes to be a leading tailor by opening more tailoring shops, to give his children a quality education, and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy textiles for making clothes

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: T. Kate is 37 years old and a mother of 4 children attending school. She is an individual client from Kihihi and a salary earner. She needs a loan to be able to buy produce for resale and the profits will help her in taking care of her children as well as paying their school fees when the term commences. She is grateful that she can use loans to increase her monthly salary.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Kyamwasha Bakyara Kwebisaho Group

texts.en: M. Victor belongs to Kyamwasha Bakyara group in Ntungamo. He is 50 years old and married with 8 children and he is involved in shoe selling from Rukoni trading center. He has been in business for 25 years selling shoes, most of which he buys from Kampala and he is able to make 150,000/= as weekly profits. He is also involved in the sale of maize, bananas and beans and he is happy about the trend that his business is taking. He has been able to expand his enterprises and educate his children and he needs a loan to be able to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.use: Buying more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Monica Wairimu

texts.en:
Monicah is 37 years, single, with one child. She runs a nursery school and also does farming. She has been in the business for a period of 10 years with an income of about Kshs. 15000 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to purchase fertilizer, pay for labor, and buy seedlings. She hopes to expand her school so that she can start on primary school. She also has the desire to offer her child a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Twisungane Bahinzi Group

texts.fr: Emmanuel M. est commerçant des récoltes, et il est un membre du groupe Twisingane Bahinzi.  Il est marié, il a fini 6 ans d’école primaire, et il a 3 enfants entre 6 ans et 12 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des récoltes, puis vente des récoltes.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire et d’acheter et vendre directement des récoltes, et aussi ajouter agriculture et élevage pour augmenter la capital.  Il voudrait avoir beaucoup capacité d’autofinancement.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait payer les minervaux de ses enfants facilement, et satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Emmanuel M. is a crop merchant, and he is a member of the Twisingane Bahinzi group. He is married, has finished 6 years of primary schooling, and has 3 children whose ages range between 6 and 12 years. One of his children attends school. He is going to use his loan to buy crops and then re-sell them. His strategy to increase his sales is to buy the crops directly, and also to add agricultural and animal-rearing activities to raise his capital. He would like to generate lots of auto-financing capacity. For his family, he would like to pay his children's school fees easily and satisfy the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell crops

loans.name: Tayangatane Group

texts.en:
Rukia K. is in her mid-fifties and married with 5 grown-up children.  She runs two businesses, selling fried fish, fruits and vegetables.  She has been in these businesses for two years now.  She works from 5:00am to 8:00pm daily and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Rukia's 6th loan from Tujujenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to increase her business stock and make bricks.  She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes to use her new loan to make more bricks and build the foundation of her house. Rukia's dream is to have her own house.

Rukia will share her loan with her loan group Tuyangatane, which has 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other responsible in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Rukia is in front, wearing a blue dress and holding a white bag.

loans.use: To make more bricks and build her house foundation

loans.name: Bukere Twimuke Group

texts.en:
M. Amos belongs to the Bukere Twimuke group from Mubende. He is 25 years old and married with 2 children.  He has a boutique that sells clothes from Kiyaka, which he has run for four years.  His customers are mostly retail buyers from his community, and he is able to make enough sales per week (i.e., 100,000 per week in local currency).  

Amos needs a loan to buy new clothes to stock his boutique for the Christmas season. Amos was inspired to start his business due to demand in his community, and he does not regret the advice he received  from his friends about starting the business. His dream is to build a store to increase his income.

loans.use: Buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachona en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Marcelina; ella es natural de Cusco y tiene 31 años de edad,  y es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos, ella trabajaba lavando autos bajo en el puente en Cachona, la socia tenía un barril con agua y otro balde de agua con detergente para lavar los autos, también tenía sus trapos para lavar y secar y junto a otros señores que también prestan este servicio eran los lava autos al paso, la socia ganaba muy bien pero después de años de hacer este trabajo ella pudo ahorrar un poco de dinero y ahora puso su pensión (restaurante pequeño); ella ahora trabaja con sus ayudantes y prepara comidas caseras, La socia también da desayunos a los choferes de taxis, ella se levanta temprano aún para hacer las comiditas y preparar los desayunos, la socia está mejor ahora que ya no tiene que llenar el cilindro con agua y llevar sus otros baldes, mas sus trapos y detergente en un triciclo hasta el puente para instalarse, era un trabajo muy pesado nos comenta y ahora está feliz con su nuevo negocio, la socia desea el préstamo para poder comprar insumos al por mayor y también para implementar un poco su pensión con la compra de sillas y mesas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas, también insumos al por mayor para su pensión.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to the 'Qorilazo' community bank which is located in Cachona district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Marcelina is originally from Cusco and is 31 years old.  She lives with her partner and has three children.  She used to work washing cars under the bridge in Cachona.  She had a barrel of water and a bucket full of water and detergent to clean cars with.  She also had her cloths for washing and drying and, together with some other people, she would provide this service to cars that passed by.  She used to earn pretty good money but, after years of doing that work,  she was able to save a little money and set up a small restaurant.  She now works with her assistants and prepares home-cooked meals.  She also makes breakfasts for taxi drivers.  She gets up early to make her meals and prepare her breakfasts.

Marcelina is doing much better now that she no longer has to fill her barrel with water and carry her other buckets and cloths and detergent in her 'triciclo' (three-wheeled vehicle) to the bridge to set herself up for work.  It was very hard work she tells us and she is happy with her new business.

Marcelina is requesting a loan to buy chairs and tables as well as supplies wholesale for her small restaurant.

Marcelina is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables.  To buy supplies wholesale for her small restaurant

loans.name: Ndakisa Plus Group

texts.en:
“Ndakisa Plus” is a group of 12 owners of small businesses chaired by Thérèse. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Thérèse sells rice in détail. She started her business in 1984. She is a hard working woman that has demonstrated some capabilities in business, such as organisation and good management. Thérèse is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. Thérèse is planning with the next loan to increase the stock of her goods by buying some sacks of rice in order to meet the high demand of her customers in her community. She is confident with her business. She knows how to attract her customers by offering what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks with her clients. Thérèse’s medium term plan is to buy a freezer in order to diversify her business and start selling soft drinks. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of seven children between the ages of 12 and 25 years old, two of whom attend school.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Daniel Mungai

texts.en:
Daniel Mungai, 35 years old, runs a general shop at Kingstone Estate, which is a densely populated area. He is married to Judith, and together, they have one daughter, Jane M..  He was introduced to KADET by another KADET client.

Daniel has been running this business for a period of seven years, and his monthly profit is Kshs 33,000.  This loan of Kshs 90,000 is his third loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use Kshs 40,000 to buy maize flour, Kshs 20,000 to buy cooking fat, Kshs 20,000 to buy wheat flour and Kshs 10,000 to buy four bags of rice. If the loan boosts his business, Daniel will open another shop.

Daniel dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stock of Maize flour, wheat flour, cooking fat and rice

loans.name: Maxime

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 41 ans,mariée et mère de 3 enfants, cliente de Hope depuis bientôt 4 mois, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de la layette comme: brassières,cache - brassières, tricots,couches, draps pour bébé , grenouillères.
Ses ventes sont de 40.000 a 150.000 fr par jour, elle a  fait preuve d'un remboursement constant et des épargnes régulières pour le premier prêt 
Elle tient a bénéficié  d'un deuxième prêt, pour faire face a ses problèmes et continuer a renforcer son activité en ajoutant de la layette qu'elle pense faire acheter a Pointe Noire , Kinshasa et aussi aux femmes commerçantes qui viennent de la France .Ses clientes sont les femmes qui viennent pour les consultations prénatales de la maternité qui est non loin de sa boutique,
Dans ses perspectives d'avenir, elle s'efforce a faire plus de bénéfices pour qu' elle  puisse  ouvrir une autre boutique   ou l'on ne trouvera que des vêtements pour nouveaux nés.
texts.en:
This merchant is 41 years old, married and the mother of three. She has been a client of Hope for almost four months. She sells baby products, such as vests, undershirts, onesies, diapers, sheets for babies, sleeper suites, etc.

Her sales range from 40,000 to 150,000 West African Francs per day. She already proved her ability to pay timely and save money after her first loan. She really hopes to obtain a second loan in order to meet her challenges and continue growing her business and having merchandise ordered from Pointe Noire, Kinshasa, and also from merchants who travel to France. Her clients are women who come for prenatal visits to the medical office located near her store. In the future, she will try to increase her revenue in order to be able to open a second store specializing exclusively in clothing for the newborns.

loans.use: Purchasing baby items: diapers, undershirts, bibs, onesies, sheets

loans.name: Florence Mumo

texts.en:
Florence Mumo is 35-years-old and sells shoes at City Stadium Market in Nairobi. She is married to Vincent Owando and together they have three daughters: Purity aged 15 years in class eight, Annah aged eight years in class three and Marion aged five years in Pre-school. She was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Florence has been running this business for a period of two years and her monthly profit is 80,000 Kshs. This loan of 15,000 Kshs is her first loan with KADET and she intends to use the loan to add to her stock of shoes before the Christmas holiday sales. If this loan boosts her business, Florence will open a motor vehicle spare parts shop.

She dreams of growing her business until it enables her to open a big store for selling cereals. She describes herself as courageous and hardworking.

loans.use: To increase the stock of shoes for Christmas holiday sales.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres de nombre Santa Maria se conformó en la fecha 10 de julio del 2008 con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el 9° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 Ademas del trabajo independiente de cada una, también fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo,a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar economicamente  a sus familiares en especial. 
 Una historia muy conmovedora la de la Sra Angela C.   ella es una señora que esta en silla de ruega y  se dedica a hacer croche cuando comenzo con la Fundación ella no tenia silla de rueda y no podia salir por la incapacidad que tenia y gracias al   Credito y a sus compañeras de comite pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su administracion.
Ella  nos comenta que mediante este credito pudo mejorar la economia de la familia  actualmente poseen ademas del ingreso de su trabajo un ingreso como humorista en la radio.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para la compra de golosinas y minicarga ya que ademas de su croche quiere hacer otras actividades.
 Según la Sra Angela C. menciono que las actividades que realizan con la Fundacion Paraguaya es muy importante ya que pudimos desarrollar nuestras capacidades de trabajo, ademas de levantar nuestra autoestima como madres trabajoras.
texts.en:
The Santa Maria Women's Committee was set up on July 10th, 2008.  With a lot of hard work and care, they are now in their 9th loan cycle, working supportively together within the program.  As well as working independently, the group's members also work to make funds so that the group itself has some capital and they help each other to achieve their goals, their main goal being to work to support their families.

Angela C.'s is a very moving story.  She is a lady who is in a wheelchair and whose business is crocheting.  When she started working with Fundación Paraguaya she didn't have a wheelchair and she couldn't leave her house because of her disability.  Thanks to her loan and her fellow committee members she was able to greatly improve her business and her running of it.

Angela tells us that thanks to her loan she was able to improve her family's finances.  They currently have not only the income from her work but also an income made as a comedian on the radio.

Angela is requesting this loan to buy candy and cell phone credits because she would like to carry out other business activities as well as her crocheting.  Angela says that the activities that the women do with Fundación Paraguaya are very important since they have helped them to develop their working capacity and also lifted their self-esteem as working mothers.

loans.use: To buy candy and cell phone credits

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy and sell hens and goats

loans.name: Lucas Kungu

texts.en:
Lucas Kungu is 28 years old and runs a motorcycle transport business popularly known as ‘bodaboda’ in Kenya. His business is in the town of Kiserian, which is a very busy place. He is married to Ann Wacu, and they have a two-year-old daughter. Lucas was introduced to KADET by another KADET client.

Lucas has been running his business for two years and his monthly profit is 20,000 Kenyan shillings. This loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings is his second loan with KADET. He intends to purchase spare parts for his motorbike with the loan. If the loan boosts his business he will purchase another motorbike and employ someone to operate it.

Lucas dreams of buying a piece of land in the future and build houses to rent out. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Anteñita Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ANTEÑITA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Iscuchaka, provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Timotea; La socia tiene 61 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene  3 hijos ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia tiene su negocio de chicharronería y venta de chicha, la socia compra chanchos y algunos también cría para su negocio, la socia también alterna su chicharronería con la venta de chicha de maíz amarillo, la socia prepara ella misma la chicha a base de maíz amarillo fermentado, la socia sigue apoyando con los estudios superiores y a cada uno de sus hijos en sus vidas particulares, ella actualmente trabaja con dos de sus hijos lo que hace del negocio que inicialmente ella lo formó ahora un negocio familiar, la socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir exclusivamente en su negocio, la socia comprar chanchos tiernos para criarlo, también comprara papa al por mayor y aceite al por mayor, la socia también invertirá en parte en la compra de maíz para la elaboración de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al comercio minorista y venden frutas, comidas, tiene su tienda de abarrotes y todos ellos crían animales menores para la venta.
La socia que está separada del grupo con chompa roja y su pequeño en brazos es la socia Yovana que no pudo asistir  ala reunión de grupo y fué al día siguiente a firmar el requerimiento de solicitud de créditos.

La socia valora el préstamo ya que dicho préstamo le da la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Timotea  belongs to the Anteñita Communal Bank.  It is located in the Iscuchaka district, Anta province, Cusco department.

Timotea is 61 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a small businesswoman.  She has a business selling fried pork rinds and “chicha” (common sweet drink made from corn).  She buys pigs and raises some of them for her business.  She alternates her business activities at her pork rind stand with selling chicha made from yellow corn.  She makes the chicha herself by using a base of fermented yellow corn.

Timotea continues to help with higher education, and she helps each one of her children in their personal lives.  She currently works with two of her children.  The business that she stared is now a family business.

She wants the loan to be able to use exclusively in her business.  She will buy young pigs to raise.  She will also buy potatoes and oil wholesale.  Additionally, she will use part of the loan to buy corn to make chicha.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her business.

The other members have small businesses.  They sell fruit, food, and have a grocery store.  All of them raise small animals to sell.

She values the loan because it gives her the opportunity to improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Saio

texts.en: Saio was born in Kabala. He is now thirty-five years old. He has a housewife and three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Saio S. sells cosmetics, cigarettes, batteries, sugar, wax cotton cloths, etc. in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Saio has been doing this business for six years now. He wants a loan of Le 3,000,000 to enable him improve on his business. With this loan, he will be able to add more of the above mentioned goods to his business and this will eventually lead to more sales and improve profit. Saio will thus be able to take greater care of his three children and wife.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, cigarettes, batteries, sugar and wax cotton cloths in large quantity to add to his business

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
This is 27 year-old Lalita S..  She is married and has two children, ages five and one. In 2007, she established  her grocery store business. She Supports her family by working 7 days a week, 8 hours a day.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods like rice, maize, and snacks for her business. In the future, Lalita plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce and milk, and staples like rice, lentils, and flour, are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profits.  By keeping lots of inventory and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women in the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
Sara Maria 30 años de edad, su esposo es el dueño del negocio por lo que trabajan en conjunto, no tiene hijos, habita en el Barrio Madrid casa # 42 en Juigalpa Chontales, es una mujer muy activa, se dedica al comercio como es compra de productos veterinarios desde hace muchos años, de donde obtiene sus ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.

Es una mujer enprendedora con muchos deseos de superacion por lo que solicita el credito para seguir creciendo en el mercado del negocio y el bienestar de su familia; es merecedora del apoyo de Kiva ya que la situacion economica esta dificil por lo tanto tienen que trabajar con creditos para mantener su liquidez y de esta manera brindar mayor estabilidad laboral y Familiar.  

Su mayor sueño es procrear sus hijos y darles lo mejor en la vida.
texts.en:
Sara Maria is 30 years old.  She and her husband work together in the business that her husband owns.  She does not have children.  She lives in the Madrid neighborhood in house # 42 in Juigalpa, Chontales.

She is a very active woman, and she is a businesswoman.  She has been buying veterinary products for many years.  That is how she gets her income to meet her obligations.

She is an enterprising woman with a lot of desire for self-improvement.  That is why she is requesting the loan in order to keep growing in the business and for her family’s well-being.  She is deserving of help from Kiva because the financial situation is difficult.  Therefore, they have to work with loans in order to maintain their liquidity.  This is the way they will have greater work and family stability.

Her greatest dream is to have children and to give them the best in their lives.

loans.use: To buy veterinary products for the business

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.pt:
Arsenia U.  nasceu na cidade de Maputo capital  de Mocambique, sul de Mocambique mae de  3 filhos que vao a escola. Fez somente 8ª classe nao continuou devido a falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem para alem da sua familia. 
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, sempre viveu na cidade de Maputo. Trabalha  como agente de servico numa escola primaria ha mais de 4 anos e nao possui nenhum empregado e tem um salario de 4.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de seus colegas de servicos que ja eram  clientes  na altura e decidiu  fazer o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento, areia, pedra, portas e outros) para Construir a sua  casa melhorada. 
Esta muito confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo determinado para poder aceder a outros emprestimos.
texts.en: Arsenia U. was born in Maputo, the capital city of Mozambique, located in the south.  She has 3 children who attend school.  She completed school through the 8th grade, but she didn't finish due to her financial situation.  She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.  She has never left her native city - she has always lived in the city of Maputo.  She has worked as a service agent in an elementary school for more than 4 years, and does not have any employees.  Her salary is 4.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and also saves a bit in her bank account.  She learned about Hluvuku through work colleagues who were already customers at that time.  She decided to request her first loan for 20.000.00mt which she will use to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stones, doors, etc.) to make improvements to her home.  She is confident that she will pay off the loan early in order to be able to request future loans.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, sand, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Sulochana

texts.en:
Mrs. Sulochana K. is 42 years old and lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores. Her son works in his own grocery store and her daughter works in a private office. 

Mrs. K. makes different varieties of pickles. It took her three months to train for this job. She sells her products in grocery stores and department stores. 

She is requesting for her fourth loan of RS 25000.00 to buy food material for her work.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
CACILDA MUCOMBO nasceu no Municipio da Catembe, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique mae de 2 filhos de 14 anos e 12 anos de idade, ambos vao a escola. Fez somente o ensino primario e nao continuou devido a casamento pre-maturo. Vive na casa dos pais e sustentanta seus filhos.
Com aguerra mudou se para a vizinha suazilandia junto com sua familia e filhos afim de procurar azilo junto daqule pais. Viveu durante 10 anos e como o seu  casamento nao durou muito, volta  ao seu pais de origem a fim de comecar uma nova etapa da sua vida e decide viver em casa dos pais onde comeca com o negocio de venda de produtos de 1 necessidade na vizinha africa do sul para o seu  auto sustento e dos filhos que trouxe do lar.
Foi atraves dos seus irmaos que ouviu a falar da Hluvuku e aproximou-se ate ao banco solicitando o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para aplicar na construcao da sua casa. O emprestimo anterior foi no valor de 7.500.00mt que foi para o comercio.
Projectos para o futuro  sera a continuacao com a construcao da sua casa,  assim como poder ter mais emprestimos para o crescimento do seu negocio porque agora ja nao fornece produtos de primeira necessidae optou por comercializar comida.
texts.en:
CACILDA MUCOMBO was born in the municipality of Catembe, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She has 2 children aged 14 and 12 who both attend school.  Shecompleted elementary school and did not finish her education due to her early marriage.  She lives with her parents and supports her children.  During the war she moved to neighboring Swaziland with her family and children to seek asylum in that country.  She lived here for 10 years but since her marriage did not last long, she returned to her home country to begin a new stage of her life.  She decided to live in her parents' home and started a business selling basic necessities in neighboring South Africa to support herself and her children.

She learned about Hluvuku through her siblings and she approached the bank to request her second loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, zinc sheets, etc.) to build her home.  Her previous loan was for 7.500.00mt which was for her business. 

Her future project is to continue construction on her home and to request additional loans to grow her business because she no longer sells basic necessities and instead has chosen to sell prepared meals.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, sand, zinc sheets, etc.)

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Catalina; ella tiene 80 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio D. venta D. artesanía y tejidos, la socia venD. en un lugar llamado baratillo que es un lugar donD. venD. todo tipo D. artículos y también  ropa D. segunda mano, su esposo es carpintero y por medio D. estos pequeños negocios sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia se levanta muy temprano y empieza a realizar los tejidos como chompas y chalinas, la socia quiere tener una tienda donD. pueda venderé los tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lanas y también para comprar artesanía.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. ropa, construcción, transporte, servicio D. taxi, restaurant y tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing the members of “Los Lideres” (The Leaders), a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Catalina is one of its members. She is 80 years old, she is married and she has 8 children. She engages in selling crafts and knitted fabrics. She works in a market called Baratillo, where they sell every kind of items, including second-hand clothes. Her husband is a carpenter and they help their children getting by thanks to these small activities. She wakes up very early to begin making fabrics such as jumpers and scarves. She wishes to run a shop of her own where to sell the knitted fabrics. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials such as wool and also to buy crafts. 

The activities of the other members are: clothe sale, construction, transportation, taxi services, restaurant and grocery store.

Catalina is happy about the loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her debt.

loans.use: To buy wool and crafs.

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Nirmala S..  She is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 5.  In 2005, she established  her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business.  In the future, Nirmala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buys food materials for her shop

loans.name: Filipe

texts.pt:
Filipe M.   nasceu na cidade da Beira,  Provincia de Sofala,  centro de Mocambique, residente no bairro de Chali distrito municipal de Katembe na Provincia de Maputo, casado e pai de 10 filhos, cujos os mais novos ainda vao a escola. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem. Nao foi possivel continuar com seus estudos porque esteve incorporado no servico militar obrigatorio  desde  1977 a   1994.
No ano 1994 ele sai da tropa onde foi desmobilisado pelas tropas das nacoes unidas .e neste momento esta trabalhando para uma organizacao de um correiano auferindo um salario estimado em 5.000.00mt e conta com ajuda da sua pensao de desmobilizacao o qual aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Este e quarto emprestimo com a Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento, barrotes, areia e outros) para continuar com a construcao da sua casa. Os outros emprestimos foram para a Habitacao.
Projectos pessoias  ‘dar continuidade da sua obra e se puder solicitar um emprstimo para mobiliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Filipe M. was born in Beira, Sofala province, in central Mozambique.  He lives in the Chali neighborhood, Katembe municipality, in the province of Maputo.  He is married and has 10 children.  The youngest children still attend school.  He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else.  He was not able to complete his education because he was drafted into mandatory military service from 1977 through 1994.    

In 1994 he left the military when he was demobilized by the United Nations troops.  He currently works for a Korean organization making a monthly salary of 5.000.00mt.  He also has a military pension which he uses for household expenses and to save a bit in his bank account.  

This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, iron bars, sand, etc.) to continue construction on his home.  His previous loans were also for his home.  

His personal project is to continue work on his home in order to request a loan to furnish it.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, iron bars, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Fatima C. ella estubo en otro grupo anteriormente y decidio retirarse y formar su propio grupo, lo cual esta yendo muy bien, todas las integrantes son del barrio Ypati de la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y se esfuerzan para tener para su pago y no fallarle a la fundacion , todas ellas se dedican a la venta de toda clase de productos ,otras tienen su trabajo seguro con sus propios sueldos .
Las reuniones se realizan en el domicilio de la Señora Fatima C., una señora muy alegre, trabajadora, honesta y todas las del grupo tambien todas son mujeres que siguen adelante con sus emprendimientos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y están muy agradecidas a la fundacion por haberles dado esta oportunidad única y por hacer posible que ellas puedan mantener a sus respectivas familias y a sus propios negocios. 
La señora Fatima se dedica a la venta de bebidas y quiero contar con buena cantidad y variedad de bebidas para este fin de año.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como vinos, sidras, cervezas y otros.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Mrs. Fatima C..  She was in another group before and decided to leave it and form her own group, which is doing very well.  All the members are from the Ypati neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa.

All the women are very hardworking and make an effort to make their payments and not fail the Foundation.  They all sell all types of products, and some of them have secure jobs with their own salaries.

The meetings are held in Fatima C.'s house.  She is very happy, hardworking and honest, and all the ladies in the group are women who move forward with their plans with great effort and dedication.  They are very grateful to the Foundation for having given them this unique opportunity and for making it possible for the ladies to support their families and keep up their businesses.

Fatima sells drinks and wants to have a good amount and variety of drinks for the end of the year.  She is asking for the loan so she can buy merchandise like wine, cider, beer and other drinks.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like wine, beer, soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
LAURA T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo,  capital de  Mocambique casada e mae de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez apenas 5ª classe nao continuou devido a gravides indesejada.  Vive  na casa propria com sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Com o credito conseguiu comprar  todo o material acordado com a Hluvuku ainda foi possivel pagar a mao de obra aos pedreiros. Conseguiu pagar de acordo com o calendario estabelecido e sem nenhuma dificuldade, com o presente emprestimo de 16.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros) para proceder com os acabamentos da sua casa. 
Projectos pessoias  ‘e poder um dia solicitar mais um credito para construir um estabelecimento comercial dentro do seu quintal para puder vender produtos alimentares para o seu beneficio e dos seus filhos que ainda vao a escola.
texts.en:
LAURA T. was born in the city of Maputo, capital of Mozambique. She is married and has 2 children who attend school.  She only attended school through the 5th grade and did not finish due to an unplanned pregnancy.  She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else. 

With a loan she was able to purchase all of the materials agreed upon with Hluvuku and was still able to pay for construction labor.  She was able to make payments on schedule without any difficulties.  With her current loan for 16.000.00mt, she plans to purchase construction materials (cement, zinc panels, iron bars, etc.) to complete her home.  

Her personal project is to one day be able to request an additional loan to build a business on her land to sell food items to support herself and her children who are still in school

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, zinc panels, iron bars, etc. )

loans.name: Tomas

texts.pt:
TOMAS M. nasceu na vila de Bela vista, Provincia de Maputo,  sul de Mocambique de 28 anos de idade, pai de 1 de filho frequentando escola. Fez somente o nivel basico e nao conseguiu continuar devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa dos pais com a sua esposa e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Quando termina o ensino basico sentiu a necssidade de deslocar a  vizinha Africa do Sul para poder trablhar porque nao tinha condicoes de voltar a  escola. Assim  foi juntando suas economias  ate que no ano passado votla e decide abrir o seu negocio proprio com seu irmao gemeo. Mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku atraves da sua mae que era cliente na altura e decide fazer um emprestimo para aumentar a mercadoria do seu negocio. 
 Este ‘e o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku e no kiva no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, vinho, refrescos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de produto no seu estabelecimento comercial.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais um credito para confecionar comidas e ter o seu proprio estabelecimento porque neste momento esta arrendar.
texts.en:
TOMAS M. was born in the town of Bela Vista, Maputo province in southern Mozambique.  He is 28 years old and has one child who attends school. He completed elementary school but was not able to continue due to financial hardship.  He lives in his parents' home with his wife and does not support anyone else.  

When he completed his studies he felt the need to move to neighboring South Africa to work because he did not have the money to return to school. He saved up money until last year when he returned to Mozambique and decided to open his own business with his twin brother.  He later learned about Hluvuku through his mother who was a customer, and he decided to request a loan to increase his inventory at his shop.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, in the amount of 12.000.00mt, which he plans to use to purchase items (beer, wine, soft drinks, etc.) to increase the quantity of products available at his shop.

loans.use: purchase products (beer, wine, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; ella tiene 40 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta, la socia tiene su stand en el mercado Virgen Asunta esto es cerca al centro de la ciudad, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja ,llevan años en este negocio. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Doris, a member of “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” (Always Ahead), a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Doris is 40 years old, she lives with her partner and they have 1 child. She alternates her daily chores with her activity, buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She has her own stand in the Virgen Asunta market located in the city center. She works together with her partner, and they have been running this activity for many years.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products for her shop.

Doris is happy about the loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her debt.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Nani Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Nani Maiya D. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband Mr. Ashukazi D. and three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her daughter is studying in grade 12, her sons are studying in grades 10 and 9 respectively.

Mrs. D. opened a grocery shop two years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. Their condition is not good, and it is hard to provide a good education for her sons because in Nepal the cost of education is very high. That's why she opened the shop.

Due to a lack of funds she can’t buy goods for her shop. So she has applied for Rs 10000.00 loan to buy goods such as rice, dal, noodles, and so on. She wants to provide a better education for her children and to help her husband to upgrade the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 46 años de edad es separada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta, la socia tiene su stand en el mercado Virgen Asunta por el centro de la ciudad , la socia trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos y se encuentra muy feliz con su negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Victoria, a member of “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” (Always Ahead), a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Victoria is 46 years old, she is separated and has 3 children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity: she buys and sells fruits and vegetables. She has her own stand in the Virgen Asunta market located in the city center. She works together with her children and she is very happy with her shop.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products for her shop.

Victoria is happy about the loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her debt.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Sylvie Varthan

texts.fr:
jeune femme de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 41 ans,a la fin de ses études; n'ayant pas trouve du travail , elle ouvre un cafeteria et ses potentiels clients sont les élèves, collégiens et lycéens d'un complexe scolaire situe non loin de son cafeteria-alimentation .
A l'octroi de son prêt, elle a renforcée le stock de ses marchandises en achetant tout ce dont ces clients ont besoin pour satisfaire leurs besoins et a aussi prit un abonnement des pains , avec livraison a domicile de 500 pains  chaque matin et soir. 
Avec le second prêt, elle tient a aller de l'avant en faisant des grandes réserves de stocks de marchandises.
tout en regardant les produits qui s'écoulent bien pour faire plus de bénéfices  pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif, celui d'ouvrir un grand restaurant.
texts.en:
This young woman is 41 years old, married, and has children. At the end of her studies, being unable to find work, she opened a cafeteria, and her potential clients are primary and secondary level students from a school complex located not far from her cafeteria.
After being granted her first loan, she strengthened her stock of merchandises by buying everything her customers need to meet their needs, and also arranged for a bread delivery service, with 500 loaves delivered to her house each morning and evening.
With the second loan, she intends to move forward by generating large reserve stocks of her merchandise. At the same time, she is watching to see which products sell well in order to generate more profits, which will allow her to achieve her goal of opening a large restaurant.

loans.use: To buy cartons of milk, canned goods, butter, margarine, and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of sewing materials: threads, needles and fabric.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Emilio Rodríguez tiene 25 años y está casado por más de 5 años con la señora Ivana Medrano Mamani, tienen 2 hijos pequeños los cuales acuden a una escuelita de la zona por las mañanas. Emilio vive en la Zona conocida como Zofraco en el barrio Monte Canto en Cochabamba, donde tiene vacas, cuya leche vende a una empresa que se encarga de elaborar diferentes productos lácteos.

Emilio es una persona joven que quiere incrementar poco a poco la cantidad de ganado lechero que tiene y de esa manera poder incrementar su producción de leche cruda aun mas. Emilio espera poder obtener este préstamo para poder comprar una vaca lechera mas y aumentar su producción de leche y así sus ingresos, y agradece mucho a la gente que por medio se kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de superarse con la compra de una vaca y espera le puedan depositar en él su confianza una vez más.

Emilio nos cuenta que en un futuro quisiera sacar un nuevo préstamo para poder construir un establo para poder alojar a su ganado y de esa manera estén más protegidos en la temporada de lluvia.
texts.en:
Emilio is 25 years old and married for more than 5 years to Ivana.  They have 2 small children who attend a little school in their zone during mornings. Emilio lives in the zone known as Zofraco, in Monte Canto barrio, Cochabamba, where he has cattle whose milk he sells to an enterprise that makes different milk products.

Emilio is a young person who wants to little by little increase his stock of milk cows and, in this way, to expand production of raw milk even more. Emilio hopes to obtain the loan so he can buy another milk cow and increase milk production and his income. He appreciates very much those who through Kiva are able to provide him an opportunity to advance with the purchase of a cow, and he hopes they will offer their confidence once again.

Emilio tells us that in the future, he wants to take out a new loan to be able to construct a stable in which he can lodge his cattle to protect them during the rainy season.

loans.use: TO BUY A MILK COW

loans.name: River

texts.es: River, de 24 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Gladis de 18 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeño River aprendió ha trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Él siembra café, cacao y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden afectar su producción. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
River is 24 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working young man who lives in his parents' house together with his 18 year-old wife Gladis.  What he wants more than anything is to improve their quality of life.  From a very early age, River learned to work on the farm together with his parents who taught him everything that needs to be done in order to achieve a good crop.

River now has his own land which he farms and takes cares of with a lot of love and patience.  He grows coffee, cacao and coca leaf.  He then takes his products to the market in the city of San Francisco to sell.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since he feels then that his hard work is bearing fruit.  River has been in this business for 3 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his crops from the insect infestations that can affect his production.  His biggest wish is to buy a car which he could use to transport his products to market.

This is River's first loan with MFP.  He knows that he must make his repayments on time and he is ready to do this.  He will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy more manure and insecticides to improve the quality of his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Domenic

texts.en:
A very driven small business owner, Domenic purchased his laundromat in 2009 in order to seek business opportunities on his own terms. 

The previous owner had focused more on taking money out of the business rather than reinvesting, leaving Domenic with some heavy work to accomplish. However, he successfully remodeled the building, replacing the floors and purchasing all new furniture. He has established a whole new feel to the business with music constantly playing and laptop accessibility for the busy Bostonian with a full service laundromat and dry cleaning service.

His day begins at 8 AM and isn’t complete until 8 PM. And it is all done in the style of what Domenic calls "a one man band." Domenic paid for all of the original remodeling of the laundromat out of pocket because a local bank declined to lend him money due to the size of his business. With this loan from ACCION USA, Domenic will be purchasing a new hot water heater to maintain the flow of business and increase his energy efficiency. His current hot water heater is 75 years old and incurs high energy costs as well as being much smaller then newer versions.

Eventually, Domenic wants to be able to purchase more stores and hire a team of employees to run his growing businesses. Watching his current business take root has inspired him to continue growing and continue to provide for the increasing number of his returning clients.


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.’

loans.use: To purchase a new hot water heater

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto zona 16 de julio. El trabaja en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa trufi 88 es socio propietario de una movilidad de transporte de pasajeros. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para refacción de su movilidad.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in his parents' home which is located in the '16 de julio' district of the city of El Alto.  He works as a member of the Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 transport syndicate.  He owns his own vehicle for transporting passengers.  This is the main source of income for supporting himself.  He does not have children and lives with his parents.

His loan will be used to refurbish his vehicle.

This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: To service and refurbish his vehicle

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura es una mujer casada y con 4 hijos en las edades de 16 a 34 años, que vive en Cundinamarca /Bogotá. Ella es una empresaria dedicada a la comercialización de prendas de cuero importadas  desde Los Ángeles ( USA ). Hace 1 año se independizó en su actual negocio, después de ser por mucho tiempo empleada como gerente de oficina un banco, lugar donde conoció la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, lo cual hizo que hoy en día le llamara la atención , ser parte del programa de microempresas;  ella alterna su actividad comercial como ejecutiva de cuentas,  también independiente , vendiendo pólizas de vida con las que obtiene ingresos por comisiones y para el próximo año espera su pensión . La microempresa  de Laura tiene en la actualidad presenta los siguientes índices financieros: un costo de ventas del 36%, la utilidad bruta es de 64%, una utilidad operativa del 40,78% del valor de las ventas y un 29,50% corresponde a la utilidad neta sobre ventas y sus indicadores de liquidez pueden soportar un endeudamiento a corto plazo; en cuanto a la rotación de inventarios es de 20 días por el tiempo que transcurre de la compra a la venta y el pago de su cartera.  Laura es una mujer dedicada a su actividad, muy organizada con sus finanzas hasta el punto de que luego de llevar muchos años trabajando con una entidad financiera, cuida mucho su vida crediticia y  hoy en día siendo independiente,  no le alcanza para obtener los puntajes que solicitan los bancos,  por eso acude a la Fundación con tal de construir su vida crediticia, abrir un mercado y aprovechar los contacto que logró por muchos años.  Este es el propósito de su credikiva, primer  crédito con la Fundación, con el  que  invertirá en capital de trabajo, para aprovechar la temporada navideña y tener un stock suficiente para suplir los pedidos de sus clientes, aumentar su capital, ser autosuficiente en el manejo de descuentos y lograr mejores márgenes de contribución; comprará así , prendas de vestir de cuero, blusas para oficina, camisetas, abrigos, chaquetas y chaquetones de cuero, perfumería, ropa interior, bolsos y botas en linea femenina.
texts.en:
Laura is a married woman with 4 children, aged 16 to 34, who lives in Cundinamarca/Bogota. She is an entrepreneur dedicated to selling leather clothing imported from Los Angeles (USA). Roughly a year ago she became independent, opening her present business, after working for a long time as manager of a bank office, where she got to know the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, which attracted her attention, in hopes of becoming part of their micro-enterprise program. She alternates her commercial activity, serving  as an account executive, then independently, selling life insurance policies, for which she receives a commission, and next year she expects to receive her pension. 

Laura's micro-enterprise presently has the following financial indices: a cost of sales of 36%, a gross profit of 64%, an operating profit of 40.78% of sales value, and a net profit over sales of 29.5%.  Indications are that her liquidity can support a short-term debt. Inventory circulation is every 20 days, from the time of purchase to sales and time of payment.

Laura is a woman who is dedicated to her activity and very well organized with her finances, even to the point where after many years working in a financial institution, she takes good care of her credit life. But, today, being independent, she is not eligible for bank loans. For this reason, she has approached this Foundation for the purpose of establishing her credit life, to open a market and take advantage of the contacts she has made over many years.

This is the reason for her Kiva loan, the first with the Foundation, which will be invested in working capital, taking advantage of the Christmas season and having sufficient stock to fulfill her customers' orders, increase her capital, and to be self-sufficient in managing discounts and gaining better tax margins. Laura will buy leather clothing, shirts, coats, jackets, perfume, underwear, and womens' purses and bags.

loans.use: TO BUY LEATHER CLOTHING ITEMS, BLOUSES FOR THE OFFICE, SHIRTS, COATS, JACKETS, PERFUME, UNDERWEAR, WOMENS PURSES AND BAGS TO SELL

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristobal vive en casa en anticretico en la zona Sopocachi, de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un hijo menor de edad; es casado, el señor es carpintero y su esposa hace labores de casa, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.
El crédito será utilizado para aumentar a sus ahorros y tomar una habitación más en anticrético para tener mayor comodidad.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito
texts.en:
Cristobal lives in a rental house in Sopocachi district of the city of La Paz.  He has one dependent child and is married.  Cristobal is a carpenter and his wife does household chores.  He uses the income he makes in his business to support his family.  This is the first time that he has taken a loan.  It will be used to increase his savings and to rent an additional room so that his family is more comfortable.

Cristobal's socio-economic profile qualifies him to receive a loan.

loans.use: To rent an additional room for his family's comfort

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos, el señor vende chompas en viajes al interior y su esposa es empleada en una artesanía, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen, en anterior crédito realizó la construcción en obra gruesa de esa habitación. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

El crédito será utilizado par la compra de estuco y cemento para terminar una habitación en la casa de sus padres.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Juan lives in his parents' house in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children. He sells sweaters on trips to the interior and his wife is employed in handicrafts. They get by with the income that they earn. The previous loan was used for the construction of the structural work of this room. He is satisfied with the loans that we have granted him.

The loan will be used for the purchase of stucco and cement in order to finish a room in his parents' house.

His previous history qualifies him for the obtention of a new loan and he is considered a good client.

loans.use: Purchase stucco and cement to finish a room

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, D. 43 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y humilD., vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Francisca a logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, cacao, café y hojas D. coca, los cuales luego llevará a vender hasta la ciudad D. San Francisco, donD. los venD. al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Francisca, 43, is a simple and humble woman.  She lives in her own house along with her three beloved children, for whom she  wants to proviD. a better quality of life.  Francisca has painstakingly worked her land and maD. it very productive.  She cultivates cocoa, coffee and coca leaves that she later takes to the city of San Francisco, Peru, to sell wholesale.  Her crops have provided her income necesary to support herself.  For this reason, she wants to put everything into building this business.

What she likes best about her job is tending her crops.  She's been doing this for 12 years and believes that the hardest thing is transporting the product.  The sacks are very heavy and carrying them wears her out.  In the future, she would like to buy new land to expland production.  This is Francisca's first loan with Kiva partner MFP.  She has been very punctual in paying off previous loans and expects to be with this one as well.  With the requested $725, she will purchase more fertilizer and insecticides to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene seis hijos, el señor es empleado cerrajero y su esposa vende pantuflas en un puesto ambulante, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen, en anterior crédito realizó la refacción de una habitaciones en su vivienda. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de cemento, arena y costo de pagar la mano de obra para refaccionar el patio de la casa de sus padres.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Victor lives in his parents' house in the Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. He is married and has six children. He is employed as a locksmith and his wife sells slippers from a travelling cart. They get by with the income they earn. The last loan was used for the refurbishment of one of the rooms in his house. He is satisfied with the loans we have given him.

The loan will be used for the purchase of cement, sand, and the cost of paying the labour in order to refurbish the patio of his parents' house. 

His previous history qualifies him for the obtention of a new loan and he is considered a good client.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and payment of labour to refurbish the patio of his parents' house.

loans.name: Machaj Mara Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “MACHAJ MARA” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN. Cuenta con nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Dionicia, por la tesorera, la señora Leonarda y como secretaria de actas Wilma.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de vísceras y otras menudencias de vaca, venta de fruta, venta de CD`s, confección de poleras, tienda de pastelería, venta de comida, venta de medias.

La señorita Dionicia presidenta de la asociación “Machaj Mara”, es una mujer joven de 27 años soltera.
