Her vision is to have her own house, educate her children and have a larger store. 

What she likes about her communal bank is the interest she earns on her savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, flour, chicken and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Remigio

texts.es:
Segundo de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador que siempre ha luchado para que su familia tenga lo mejor. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado en una actividad que desde pequeño la aprendió por sus padres. 

En la actualidad tiene un taller de calzado en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja con ayuda de su esposa de lunes a sabado elaborando calzado y reparándolos. El quiere seguir trabajando para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 12 años que estudian en un colegio fiscal. 

Para hacer mas calzado él quiere comprar con el préstamo cuero, pegamento. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de calzado amplio y bien construida su casa.
texts.en: Segundo is 53 years old. He is a hard-working man who is always fighting to make things better for his family. He lives in a suburban area called Perimetral and has worked from a young age learning the trade of his parents. Currently he has a shoe shop in the front part of his home. He works with the help of his wife from Monday to Saturday making footwear and doing repairs. He wants to keep working so he can provide for his wife and their two children, ages 14 and 12, who are in school. In order to make more shoes he is requesting the loan so he can purchase leather and glue. In the future he wants to expand his shop and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Purchase leather, glue

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y tiene  02 hijos.  Tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta.

Hace 04 meses trabaja con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá  comprando más ropas de segunda mano,  vende solo los días sábados.

Su visión en el negocio es poner una tienda de venta de ollas y utensilios en general.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en: Elena is a member of "Las Kantutas" community bank in the district and province of Puno, Peru. She is 38 years old, single and has two children. She has an incomplete higher education. For the past four months she has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. Her initial loan was for 500 soles, which she invested into her business. Elena makes a living selling clothing. She is requesting a new loan of 500 soles to purchase more second-hand clothing, which she sells only on Saturdays. Her vision for the future is to have a store selling pots, pans and general cooking utensils. What she likes about her community bank is the simplicity of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase second-hand clothing

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: Salome, de 31 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Dany de 31 años y de sus 4 hijas menores, juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de trozos de pollos fritos, de manera ambulatoria, y le va muy bien pues las ganancias son bastante generosas. Realiza su negocio de manera ambulatoria en una calle de su zona y empieza desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche, y tiene varios comensales que prefieren sus platillos por los buenos precios y el sabor, es por esta razón que tiene buena salida sobretodo durante los fines de semana. Aunque atiende el negocio sola, a veces le ayudan sus hijas ya que le faltan manos para atender a sus clientes.  Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene muchos planes como el de instalar un negocio de venta de diversos platillos. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Salome tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes (como arroz, aceite, especerías entre otros) que necesita para continuar adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Salome is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Dany, 31, and their four young daughters. Together they work hard every day to keep making headway. For the past two years this hard-working woman has made a living selling fried chicken on the street, and it has gone very well since her profits are quite good. She works on the streets in her area from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m. and has a variety of customers who prefer her meals for the good price and flavor. It's for this reason she has good results, especially on the weekend. Although she alone tends to her business, sometimes her daughters will help her so she can keep up with demand. As an enterprising woman she has a lot of plans for her business in the future to sell a wide variety of meals. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. She is very grateful to all the people who made this possible to allow her to continue working in search of progress. Salome plans to invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of ingredients (rice, oil, spices, among other items) that she needs to continue moving forward with her business.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as oil, rice, spices and other items

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, casada, un hijo, ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de carne y otros productos, también tiene como ingreso la pensión mínima de la jubilación de su esposo. Toda madre desea lo mejor para el futuro de su hijo por eso tiene dentro de sus planes de vida la preparación de los estudios. Desde hace 8 años tiene su negocio iniciándolo con fondo de préstamos brindado por la asociación afodenic, siendo unos de los principales fomentadores del crecimiento del comercio. Con vista a corto plazo que sus productos se venda y aumentar el inventario en estos tiempos solicitad su préstamo para la compra de: carne de res, el cual la compra en un matadero, logrando mejores precios de proveedores, y así dar a mejores precios a sus clientes, también la compra de pacas de ropa de niños, damas y caballeros. Obteniendo mayores ganancia y así cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Rosa is an enterprising woman.  She is married, has one child, and has her own business selling meat and other products.  She also has an additional income through her husband's small retirement pension.

Every mother wants the best for their children's future.  For this reason, Rosa is planning to prepare for her child's studies.  Rosa has had her business for 8 years.  She set it up with loans provided by Afodenic which helped encourage the growth of her business.  In the short term, Rosa would like her products to sell and to increase her inventory.  She is requesting this loan to buy beef which she buys from a slaughterhouse.  This way, she gets the meat for a better price and can therefore sell it to her customers for a better price too.  She would also like to buy bundles of children's, women's and men's clothes.  This will help her make more profits and thereby achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Felipa Candelaria

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  del distrito y provincia D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene  02 hijos independientes.  La señora estudió hasta 2do D. educación primaria.

Viene trabajando  con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desD. hace 08 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artículos artesanales.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar totoras (planta D. la región) y otros materiales para la fabricación D. sus balsas D. totora, trabaja junto con su esposo.

Su visión es mejorar el negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos.
	
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank in the district and province of Puno.  She is 60 years old, married and has two independent children.  She studied up to the second year of elementary school.

Felipa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling hand-maD. fireworks.

Felipa is requesting a new loan for 700 Peruvian soles which she will use to buy 'totoras' (a native plant) and other materials for making her totora rafts.  She works together with her husband.

Felipa's vision is to improve her business and, above all, improve her profits.  What she most likes about her community bank is how much her savings make.

loans.use: To buy 'totora' (a native plant) and other materials to make her totora rafts

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene  03 hijos.  La señora estudió hasta 3ro de educación primaria.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento   Manuela  Ramos desde hace 09 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Con su nuevo crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá para comprar mercaderías para su tienda e insumos para la producción de chicha.  En este negocio la ayuda su hija .

Su visión es mejorar el negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en: Fortunata is a member of "Las Kantutas" community bank in the district and province of Puno, Peru. She is 55 years old, married and has three children. She has a third-grade education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past nine years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in her general store. With this new loan of 600 soles, she plans to invest in the purchase of supplies for her store as well as ingredients to make chicha (a corn-based alcoholic beverage). Her daughter helps her with the business. Her vision for the future is to improve her business and increase her profits. What she likes about her community bank is the punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her store and ingredients to make chicha

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel tiene 52 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Dio inicio a mayoría hace más de 30 años. Maria trabaja todos los días para atender a sus clientes que llegan a solicitar de sus diferentes productos las comprar las realiza en el mercado. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, entre otras cosas. Ya que se acerca una buena temporada y quiere ofrecer de todo un poco. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 52 years old and makes a living with her general store, which she started more than 30 years ago. Maria works every day to tend to her customers who come to buy her products, which she acquires from the local market. She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as snacks, drinks, bread and detergents, among other items, since the good season is approaching and she wants to offer a little of everything. Her dream is to improve her home and meet her business objective.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es:
Xiomara de 38 años, madre soltera de tres hijos, los tiene estudiando. Los planes futuro para con la familia es que se preparen en el estudio y llegue han ser unos profesionales. Es difícil sacar adelantes sola pero no es imposible por tal ella Trabajo en un empresa privada como empacadora de químicos desde hace 1 año. Vela mucho por la seguridad de su hogar y de su familia. Su casa falta de muchas mejorar pero lo más importante que necesita es la construcción del muro. Gracias a este préstamos en la financiera afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques, piedra cantera, andamio, clavos de acero, arena y otros materiales. 
Contenta por que obtendrá una solución que a su vez le brindara seguridad y protección a su hogar.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 38 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children who are all studying.  Her future plans for her family is for them to study and become professionals.  It is difficult to get children ahead in life on your own but not impossible.  For this reason, Xiomara works in a private company packing chemicals.  She has been in this job for one year. 

Xiomara looks after her household and family security.  Her house lacks a lot of improvements but the most important thing it needs is a wall building.  Thanks to this loan from Afodenic, she will buy building materials such as cement, iron, blocks, stone, scaffolding, steel nails, sand and other materials.

Xiomara is happy that she will be able to have this work done as it will provide security and protection for her home.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia sola, pues sus hijos ya tienen sus propias familias y la visitan de vez en cuando. Desde hace 4 años esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de la zona donde vive. Cada día se despierta muy temprano para empezar a cocinar pues debe tener listos, al mediodía, 30 platillos que ofrece a sus habituales comensales; y le gusta mucho su labor pues le entretiene y le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Lo que no le agrada es que cuando brinda los platillos a crédito algunos comensales se atrasan en el pago puntual y esto retarda un poco sus ganancias. Vende sus platillos desde las 12 hasta las 2 de la tarde y ya en la tarde descansa de su labor. Y como tiene muchos planes, para el futuro tiene el anhelo de instalar un restaurante en su zona, donde ofrecerá sus mejores platillos, de esta manera espera seguir progresando. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Evarista tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, que le hacen falta para continuar preparando sus platillos en mayor cantidad, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Evarista is 50 years old and lives alone in her own home, as her children now have their own families and they come to visit from time to time.  For the last 4 years this enterprising woman has sold food in a local market.  Every day she wakes up very early to start cooking, for by noon she must have available 30 meals, which she offers to her regular diners.  She likes her work a lot, for it keeps her busy and generates regular earnings, which allow her to live comfortably.  What she doesn’t like is that when she offers meals on credit, some diners fall behind in paying punctually, and this slows down her revenue.  She sells her meals from 12 noon to 2 in the afternoon, and then rests from her work.  She has many plans, such as for the future she would like to set up a restaurant in the area, where she will offer her best meals.  She hopes thereby to continue to grow.  This is the second loan she will have with MFP, and she promises to pay the installments promptly, for she is very grateful to all those who have made this support possible, which will enable her to keep working and moving forward.  Evarista plans to use the requested loan to buy wholesale the commodities needed to continue preparing her meals in larger quantities.  She thus hopes to keep on making progress.

loans.use: To buy commodities wholesale, and avoid problems when preparing her meals

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 menores hijos; y cada día que pasa esta emprendedora mujer se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante. Hace más de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, le gusta el negocio pues mientras ofrece los productos se entretiene recomendando las tonalidades y perfumes que mejor le conviene a su cliente. Paralelamente a este negocio se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado que ella compra en la ciudad, al por mayor, y vende a sus clientes de su zona y también de otras ciudades. Le gusta mucho su negocio, pues es bastante rentable ya que  las prendas que ella ofrece son de calidad y a buenos precios. Aunque trabaja sola, algunas veces la ayudan sus sobrinos, quienes ofrecen las prendas a sus conocidos. Como Rosalina es una mujer muy emprendedora, que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante tiene planeado para el futuro instalar un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado en algún centro comercial de la ciudad. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, y agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosalina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en ropa y calzado, pues tiene un gran pedido de ropa de verano y quiere cumplir para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Rosalina is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her 2 minor children. Every day this enterprising woman works to get ahead. For more than 4 years, she has sold beauty products of a recognized brand. She likes the business because while she is offering the products she entertains herself recommending the tones and perfumes that are best for the customer.  In addition to this business she also sells clothing and shoes that she buys in the city wholesale. She sells to her customers in her area and also in other cities. She really likes her business because it is very profitable since the articles she offers are of good quality and at a good price. Although she works alone, sometimes her nieces and nephews help her offering the items to their acquaintances. Since Rosalina is a very enterprising woman who really wants to get ahead, she is planning on opening a business selling clothing and shoes in a mall in the future. This is the second loan she has with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time. She s grateful to all of the people who made this possible, since it will allow her to continue working, seeking progress. Rosalina is planning on investing the loan in buying a large quantity of clothing and shoes. She has a lot of orders for summer clothing and she wants to fill them in order to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes merchandise in summer styles.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa G. G.  se dedica la venta de artículos personales y de ropa por catalogo 
Ella tiene ya un año de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, pero ella desea mejorar su negocio y crear un capital de trabajo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es por eso que ella necesita ₡603 000(seiscientos tres mil colones) para  la compra de mas mercadería para la venta. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Rosa G. G. sells personal products and clothing from catalogs. She has already been in this business for one year but she wants to improve her business and grow her working capital to improve her service to her customers. For this reason she is requesting a loan of ₡603 000 to purchase more merchandise to sell. 

She is a member of the Canalete Communal Bank, one of EDESA's 100 partner organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Roberta Zenaida

texts.es:
Roberta de 18 años, es comerciante informal de productos de belleza, ropa y juguetes. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado vendiendo los productos de belleza Avon etc. 

Siguiendo con esta actividad ha podido solventar sus gastos promocionando en el sector donde vive su mercadería. Vende juguetes para niños y niñas, ropa, cosméticos Avon con ayuda de su mama. Ella quiere seguir con las ventas de su mercadería por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo juguetes por la época navideña ya que hay mucha demanda, ropa y cosméticos para sus clientes mujeres. 

En el futuro quiere incrementa su mercadería y tener un local para tener suficientes ingresos.
texts.en:
Roberta is 18 years old.  She is an informal saleswoman who sells beauty products, clothes and toys.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral and works selling Avon beauty products, etc.

Through her business, Roberta has been able to cover her expenses, promoting her merchandise in the area where she lives.  She sells boys' and girls' toys, clothes and Avon cosmetics with the help of her mom.  She would like to continue selling her merchandise and would like to use her loan to buy toys for the Christmas season since there is a high demand.  She will also buy clothes and cosmetics for her female customers.

In the future, Roberta would like to increase her merchandise and have sales premises so that she can make enough income.

loans.use: To buy toys and clothes

loans.name: Bludith

texts.es:
La señora Bludith es socia del banco comunal El Oriente del distrito D. Campo verD., Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 50 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, uno D. ellos está en su poder.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años, tiene un pequeño restaurante, en el que ha puesto todo su esfuerzo para sacarlo adelante y cada día está mejorando, variando todos los días el menú, atienD. todo los días desD. muy temprano hasta las tres D. la tarD., por las tardes realiza las compras para preparar el menú del día siguiente.
La señora Bludith invertirá el nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 soles en la compra D. una cocina, 2 balones D. gas, 5 paquetes D. gaseosas, 2 paquetes D. agua, 2 jabas D. gaseosa personal, 1 juego D. mesa y 7 metros D. plástico para mantel.
La señora Bludith está muy feliz porque gracias a las ganancias D. su negocio pueD. seguir pagando los estudios D. su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bludith is a member of the El Oriente Community Bank in the Campo VerD. District in the department of Ucayali. She is fifty years old, married with six children. One of the children lives at home.
She has been receiving loans from Manuela Ramos for the past two years. She owns a small restaurant, where she dedicates all of her effort in order to progress. Each day the restaurant is improving. She changes the menu daily. She is at the restaurant every day from very early in the morning until three in the afternoon. In the evenings she purchases the supplies she needs to prepare the menu for the next day.
Mrs. Bludith would like to use this new loan of 1000.00 soles to buy things for the kitchen. She would like two tanks of gas, five packs of sodas, two packs of water, two crates of individual sodas, one place setting for the table and seven meters of plastic for a tablecloth.
Mrs. Bludith is very happy because, thanks to her business earnings, she can pay for her child’s education.

loans.use: She will buy things for the tables and sodas.

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Suma Sartawi” está iniciando su ciclo número uno en el Centro Focal de GERMAN BUSCH. Cuenta con ocho integrantes, un varón y siete mujeres.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Nilda, por la tesorera, la señora Virginia y como secretaria de actas Jaqueline.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de ropa, taller de cerrajería (elaboración de cocinas), venta de fruta, venta de salchipapas, taller de cocinas, artesanìa de mantillas en lana de alpaca, artesanìa en tejidos y venta de comida. 


La señora  Nilda presidenta de la BC “Suma Sartawi”, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Es profesora y también artesana, pues elabora variedad de artesanías: pintado en tela, macramé, tejido, bordado.  Para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, la señora Nilda  indica que cada cierto tiempo pasa clases de actualización y ella a su vez también da clases a otras señoras interesadas.  Expone sus trabajos en las ferias y exposiciones de unidades educativas.  Este es el primer ciclo de crédito de la señora en Pro Mujer, aunque comenta que no es la primera vez que ha solicitado crédito.  Ella comentaba con mucha satisfacción que las promotoras de Pro Mujer llegaron justo a tiempo, pues ella necesitaba un crédito para impulsar su negocio.  Cuando le consultan sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y la posibilidad de crecer con el grupo. El crédito que esta recibiendo será utilizado en la compra de materiales para artesanía.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Suma Sartawi," is starting their first cycle in the Centro Focal de German Busch.  It is composed of eight members, one man and seven women.  The director's board consists of the president, Nilda, the treasurer, Virginia, and the secretary, Jaqueline.  The women's businesses are related to sales, production and service, such as, the sale of clothes, locksmith (the elaboration of kitchens), the sale of fruit, "salchipapas" (french fries with sausage), cooking workshops, artisan blankets of alpaca wool, woven items, and the sale of food.  

Nilda is the president of this communal bank "Suma Sartawi."  She is married and has four children.  She is a professor and also an artisan, who makes a variety of art work: cloth paintings, macrame, weaves, and embroidery.  In order to keep her clients satisfied, Nilda indicates that every once in awhile, she takes classes and also teaches classes to other interested women.  She displays her work at fairs and educational and school expos.  While this is her first credit cycle with Pro Mujer, she comments that this is not her first time applying for a loan.  She also states, with great satisfaction, that the promoters of Pro Mujer arrived right on time, since she needed a credit to move her business along.  When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the credit and the possibility of growing with the group.  The credit that she receives would be used towards the purchase of artisan materials.

loans.use: Purchase materials: wool, cloth, paint.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, 58 años, es una madre muy dedicada a su familia y a su trabajo, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 30 años,  trabaja apoyando a su esposo, quien se dedica al trabajo D. cerrajería  y  fabricación D. muebles a base D. fierros, en su taller, que se encuentra ubicado en el primer ambiente D. su casa. Para Elena sus días son D. arduo trabajo, por las mañanas prepara el alimento para su familia y para los empleados que trabajan junto a su esposo, y por las tardes  se dedica a coser, tapizar los forros para las sillas y muebles que su esposo fabrica. Es así como se encarga D. darle los toques finales D. los muebles que fabrican, y del que tiene mucha acogida por parte D. sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo, es la independencia en el desarrollo D. su trabajo y además lo rentable que es. En adelante, anhela ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus herramientas D. trabajo. Es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y en su banco comunal, se considera como una socia muy entretenida. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará  fierros, ángulos, D. esa manera incrementará su stock D. materiales para continuar trabajando con tranquilidad.
texts.en: Elena, age 58, is a mother who is extremely dedicated to both her family and her work. She lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own house. For over 30 years, she has worked helping her husband, who is a locksmith and maker of wrought-iron furniture, in the workshop in the front part of their home. For Elena, the days are hard work. In the mornings she prepares food for the family and the employees who work with her husband, and in the afternoons she is busy sewing: making upholstered covers for the furniture her husband makes. In this way, she is in charge of putting the finishing touches to the furniture they make, and these are well-received by her customers. What she likes best about her job is the freedom she has in her work, and also the fact it is so profitable. Going forward, she hopes to enlarge the business and get better tools to work with. This is her 9th loan from [field partner] MFP, and she promises to make her repayments on time. The others in her communal bank consider her a very pleasant member of the group. With the loan she is seeking, she will buy iron, and thus increase her stock of materials to continue working and have peace of mind.

loans.use: To buy iron and tools she needs for her workshop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Madres Coraje  del distrito de Calleria departamento de Ucayali, tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.
Ya que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes ha decido poner un pequeño negocio de venta de  productos comestibles (bodega)que poco a poco está implementando.
Rosa es la que atiende en su negocio que está en su misma casa y que le permite al mismo tiempo poder estar cerca a sus hijos pequeños, de esa manera puede contribuir con los ingresos a su hogar y después distribuirlos para hacer los pagos de los servicios básicos del hogar.
Con éste préstamo de S/.1,000.00 comprará productos para surtir un poco mas su negocio, comprará 1 paquete de sal, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 paquetes de fideo, 1 caja de aceite, ½ caja de vinagre, ½ caja de sillao, 3 tiras de sazonadores, 1 bolsa de detergente, 2 paquetes de papel higiénico, 10 kilos de papa, 3 kilos de cebolla, 2 kilos de tomate y otros productos más.
La señora Rosa desea seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos y así poder seguir apoyando a su esposo para mejorar la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank Madres Coraje in the Calleria district, department of Ucayali.  She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband works in civil construction.   Since her husband's income is not sufficient, she decided to start her own small business selling grocery products and, little by little, business is picking up.  Rosa runs her store out of her house.  This allows her to be near her young children and to contribute to the household income and pay for basic services.  

She is requesting a loan of S/.1,000.00 to purchase merchandise in order to increase her stock a bit more.  She will buy 1 package of salt, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 packages of noodles, 1 case of oil, 1/2 case of vinegar, 1/2 case of soy sauce, seasonings, 1 bag of detergent, 2 packages of toilet paper, 10 kilos of potatoes, 3 kilos of onions, 2 kilos of tomatoes and other products.  Señora Rosa wants to continue working with Manuela Ramos in order to be able to continue supporting her husband and improve their family's financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos S. C. es uno de los albañiles (Constructor) mas populares de Canalete de Alajuela.
Desde muy joven, trabajo en construcción con su padre y aprendió todo lo necesario para ser uno de los más buscados en la zona, ya que su trabajo es de gran calidad. Para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes Don Carlos necesita ₡598 000 (quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones) para la compra de herramientas  y materiales que necesita para trabajar, por ejemplo una máquina de batir cemento, entre otras.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carlos S. C. is one of the most popular builders in Canalete de Alajuela.  He has worked in the building trade with his father since he was a young boy.  He learned all he needed to learn to become one of the most sought-after builders in his area as he does good quality work.  In order to provide his customers with a better service, Carlos needs 598,000 colones to buy tools and materials for his work such as, for example, a cement mixer.

Carlos is a member of the 'Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete' (Canalete Communal Credit Company) which is one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila M. G. es una mujer conocida por su liderazgo  y sueña  con tener su propia tiendita.
Ella tiene ya varios años de dedicarse  a la venta de ropa y artículos de uso personal  por catalogo, visitando sus clientes a sus casas. En este momento ella está solicitando un préstamo de   ₡598 000 (quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones)  para la compra de mas mercancía para vender.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Camila M. G. is a woman who is known for her leadership and she dreams of owning her own small store.  She has been selling clothes and personal use products through a catalog for several years, visiting her customers in their homes.  She is currently requesting a loan for 598,000 colones so that she can buy more merchandise to sell.  She is a member of the 'Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete' (Canalete Communal Credit Company) which is one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Desideria

texts.es:
Desideria B. B. es conocida  por el buen sabor de sus  platillos, ella es de canalete de Alajuela.
Doña Desideria trabaja como cocinera en una de los restaurantes de la zona, pero desde hace varios años también se dedica  al engordo de pollos para la venta. Es por eso que ella necesita un préstamo de  ₡599 000 (quinientos noventa y nueve mil colones) para la compra de mas pollos y alimento para ellos. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Desideria B. B. is known for the good taste of her meals.  She is from Canalete de Alajuela and works as a cook in a local restaurant.  However, for several years she has also worked fattening chickens for sale.  It is for this business that she needs a loan for 599,000 colones, so that she can buy more chickens and more chicken feed.

Desideria is a member of 'Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete' (Canalete Communal Credit Company) which is one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Chickens, infrastructure, chicken feed

loans.name: Francisca Marisol

texts.es: Francisca Marisol se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio porque ella vendía cereales de maíz, trigo, entre otros productos pero con el paso del tiempo ella decide establecer su propio molino y así brindar este tipo de servicio a las personas que viven cerca y algunas que llegan de largas distancias. El motivo del financiamiento es para la reparación y mantenimiento de molinos y en la compra de repuestos necesarios.
texts.en: Francisca Marisol provides a milling service.  She has had this business for more than 5 years.  She started in the business because she was selling cereals, corn, wheat, etc. but, over time, she decided to set up her own mill and provide this service to the people who live nearby and also some who travel long distances.  Francisca Marisol will use her loan to repair and service her mill and to buy the spare parts she needs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Olinda Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Olinda es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras del distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 68 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos mayores, profesionales que ha tenido que sacar adelante gracias a su esfuerzo.
Olinda lleva año y medio trabajando con los créditos D. Manuela Ramos, que le ha servido para poder surtir su pequeña bodega que tiene en su casa, donD.  vive  con su esposo  y trabajan  juntos. 
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Soles, invertirá en la compra D. 3 paquetes D. gaseosas D. diferentes tamaños, 2 cajas D. galletas, 1 caja D. aceite D. ½ litro, 1 caja D. leche chica, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 saco D. arroz, 1 caja D. aceite, 2 paquetes D. fideos, 2 bolsa D. detergente, ½ paquete D. lejía, 3 casilleros D. huevos, 3 paquetes D. papel higiénico, 2 cajas D. chocolate, ½ kilo D. canela y ½ kilo D. clavo D. olor.
La señora Olinda está contenta porque todavía tiene fuerzas para  poder seguir trabajando y eso le da cierta tranquilidad, agradece a Manuela Ramos por los créditos otorgados a su persona.
texts.en:
Olinda is a member of the Las Almendras community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 68 years old and has two grown-up children who are professionals.  She managed to get them ahead in life thanks to her hard work.

Olinda has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for a year and a half.  She has used them to stock her small grocery store which is located in her home where she lives with her husband.  They work together.

Olinda will invest this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles in buying 3 packs of soda in different sizes, 2 boxes of cookies, 1 box of oil in ½ liter bottles, 1 box of milk, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice, 2 packs of noodles, 2 bags of detergent, ½ pack of bleach, 3 packs of toilet paper, 2 boxes of chocolate, ½ kilo of cinnamon and ½ kilo of cloves.

Olinda is happy that she still has the strength to continue working and this gives her a certain amount of peace.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans that she has received.

loans.use: 3 packs of soda in different sizes, 2 boxes of cookies, 1 box of oil in ½ liter bottles, 1 box of milk, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice, 2 packs of noodles, 2 bags of detergent, ½ pack of bleach, 3 trays of eggs, 3 packs of toilet paper, 2 boxes of chocolate, ½ kilo of cinnamon and ½ kilo of cloves

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: Alba madre soltera, tiene a sus hijos estudiando, los planes es que sus hijos se preparen para que tenga mayor opción de trabajo. Tiene su propio negocio de ventas de cosméticos desde hace 8 años, lo inicio con fondo propios ahorros que poseía en esos tiempo lo cual solo vendía pequeñas cantidades y encargos que le realizaban.  Por medio de los prestamos que ha realizado con nosotros a ingresado otras productos y mantener en existencia para ofrecer a sus cliente en el momento que lo busca. Dentro de sus proyectos es agrandar más su negocio en corto plazo. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de: sombras para ojo, lápiz labial, lápiz de ceja, tintes para el cabello, pintura labial, delineadores, marbellí, pulsera de fantasía y de oro, chapas, anillos de fantasía y de oro, aretes de oro, entre otros productos para mayor variedad. Obteniendo mayores ingresos y ofreciéndole a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Alba is a single mother.  Her children are in school and the idea is for them to study what will give them the best chance of finding work. She has had her own cosmetics sales business for the last 8 years that she began with the savings from those days.  She didn't sell very much in general, just some orders that she had.  With the loans that she has received from us she has included other products and has been able to keep inventory to sell to her customers when they are looking for items.  One of her projects is to enlarge her business soon.  The loan will be used to buy: eye shadows, lip liners, eyebrow pencils, hair coloring, lipsticks, eyeliners, marbellí, costume and gold bracelets, earrings, costume and gold rings, gold hoops, etc, to have a greater variety.  Getting more income will allow her to offer her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Cosmetics sales

loans.name: Jimmy Anderson

texts.es:
Jimmy de 28 años, es taxista informal de las calles de Guayaquil desde que su papa le regalo un carro y el decidió convertirlo en su actividad económica.  

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha estado trabajando como taxista informal para tener sus propios ingresos  y no estar sujeto a dependencia. Trabajando desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días, haciendo carreras desde $ 1.00 hasta $ 15.00 ha podido mantenerse. 

 Pero como él vive en un lugar que recién se está reestructurando quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques y pinturas para mejora su vivienda ya que su casa es de ladrillos. En el futuro quiere comprar otro carro y formar un hogar.
texts.en:
28 year-old Jimmy has been an informal taxi driver in the streets of Guayaquil since his dad gave him a car and he decided to turn it into his business.

Jimmy lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral.  He has been working as an informal taxi driver so that he can have his own income and not have to be dependent.  He works from 6.00am to 8.00pm every day, making journeys for between $1.00 and $15.00.  This has enabled him to support himself.

As he lives in a place that is restructuring, he would like to use his loan to buy building materials such as cement, blocks and paint to improve his home since his house is made from brick.  In the future, he would like to buy another car and have a family.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 54 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija Isabel de15 años. Hace muchos años atrás Elvira decidió dedicarse a la venta de golosinas, negocio que se encuentra ubicado cerca al ovalo de una avenida principal de su distrito, en un pequeña carretilla. Desde entonces atiende todos los días a sus clientes, en este trabajo su hija la apoya cuando no tiene responsabilidad escolar; ya que así puede ir Elvira al mercado central para abastecerse de más mercadería. Le gusta el negocio que realiza por las buenas utilidades que recibe. Sin embargo esta expuesta a diversos riesgos cuando trabajo hasta altas horas por la noche. Mas adelante piensa ampliar su negocio y paralelo a ello, empezar con la venta de comida. Es su noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor facilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde es muy respetada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversidad de golosinas para tener su negocio siempre muy atractivo.
texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old and a hard working, responsible mother who lives in her own home, along with her husband and 15 year old daughter, Isabel.  A few years ago, Elvira decided to begin selling snacks.  Her business, a small cart, is located along a main street in her district.  Since then she's been serving her customers daily.  Her daughter helps her when she's not in school or studying.  This allows Elvira to go to the market to stock up on merchandise.  She enjoys her business because of the good profits it generates for her.  Never the less she is subject to various risks when she works late into the night.

In the future she plans to expand her business and begin selling food as a parallel business.  This will be her ninth loan through MFP.  She knows that if she repays this one on time, she will be able to get another one more easily, without placing a burden on the members of her communal bank, where she is well respected.

She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of snacks in order to make her business an attractive one.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 43 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de realizar esta actividad todos los días, pues sus clientes llegan a comprar sus productos como golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos. Ella ha tomado experiencia en este tipo de negocio pues es una persona muy trabajadora. Ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima y aprovechar estar festividades.
texts.en: Haydee is 43 years old and owns a small general shop.  She has had this business for over eight years.  She is a very responsible person and enjoys working there every day.  Her clients come to purchase gummy candy, refreshments, bread, detergent, and basic grains.  She has had experience in this type of business and is very hard working.  She is requesting a credit to purchase raw materials and take advantage of the holiday season.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
La señora Lupe es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras. Distrito de calleria departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos mayores e independientes.
La señora Lupe tuvo que trabajar duro para poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos,  a sus años quiere seguir trabajando porque no quiere ser carga para sus hijos y poder sustentar sus propios gastos.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 soles comprará 500 pollos bebés y 10 sacos de alimentos balanceado y todas las vitaminas que necesitan los pollos.
Lupe lleva 5 años perteneciendo a la familia de Manuela Ramos, que le ha brindado la oportunidad de poder trabajar en forma independiente.

La fotografía está un poco oscura ya que se encuentra bajo el toldo del criadero de pollos.
texts.en:
Señora Lupe is a member of the communal bank, The Almonds ("Las Almendras"), in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 60 years old, a widow, and has 3 older and independent children.  

Señora Lupe has had to work very hard to be able to move her three children forward.  At her age, she wants to continue working because she does not want to depend on her children and would like to be able to cover her own living costs.  With this loan of 2,000 soles, she plans to purchase 500 chicks and 10 sacks of feed, with the balanced vitamins that her chicks need.  Lupe has spent 5 years as a member of the family of Manuela Ramos, who has given her the opportunity to be able to work independently.  The photograph is a bit dark since she is underneath the awning of her chick farm.

loans.use: Purchase chicks.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del banco comunal El Oriente, del distrito de campo verde, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 35 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña como mecánico, tiene 3 hijos menores y uno recién nacido, por ese motivo estos días está de descanso, su esposo es el único que está trabajando.
La señora Norma se dedica a la venta de comida, es una gran ayuda para su esposo, por los ingresos que genera a su hogar.
Con el nuevo préstamo de S/.1000.00 soles comprará una salchipapera (carro de metal diseñado para la venta de comida rápida)y 2 balones de gas, con eso podrá trabajar más tranquila, podrá comprar un balón de gas para repuesto.
La señora Norma se siente tranquila porque tiene la posibilidad de apoyar a su esposo con algunos gastos de la casa y puede cuidar a sus hijos.
  
En la foto se muestra junto a su hijo recién nacido.
texts.en: Señora Norma is a member of the communal bank, The East ("El Oriente"), of the green field district of the Department of Ucayali.  She is 35 years old and her husband works as a mechanic.  She has three younger children and a newborn.  As such, she has been resting these days.  Her husband is the only one working right now.  Señora Norma works in food sales and is a great help to her husband with the earnings that she contributes towards their household.  With this new loan of 1000.00 soles, she plans on purchasing a "salchipapera" (a metal food cart designed to sell fast food) and 2 gas tanks, with which she would be able to work with greater ease.  She would also be able to purchase a substitute gas tank.  She feels good because she has the opportunity of helping her husband with some of the household costs and in taking care of her children.  The photo shows her with her newborn.

loans.use: Purchase a metal fast food cart.

loans.name: Edwin Loenzo

texts.es:
Edwin de 46 años, es taxista informal de las calles de Guayaquil desde que pudo obtener un crédito y lo invirtió en un carro y así el decidió convertirlo en su actividad económica.  

Viviendo con su esposa y tres hijas en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha estado trabajando como taxista informal para tener sus propios ingresos y también le ayuda a su esposa en la comprar y venta de las legumbres. Trabajando desde muy temprano todos los días, haciendo carreras desde $ 1.50 hasta $ 14.00 ha podido mantenerse. 

Quiere utiliza el préstamo para ayudarla en los estudios a su hija ya que está en la universidad y necesita de dinero para poder solventar todos los gastos académicos. En el futuro quiere comprar otro carro y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en: Edwin, 46 years old, is an informal taxi driver in the streets of Guayaquil. When he was given a loan, he invested it in a car and then decided to use this car to make money. Living with his wife and three daughters on the periphery of Perimetral, he has been working as an informal taxi driver to make his own income. Additionally he helps his wife with buying and selling vegetables. He has been able to support himself by starting work early each day and giving rides that cost between $1.50 and $14.00. He would like to use this loan in order to help his daughter continue her education. She is already in college but she needs money in order to be able to cover all of the academic costs. In the future, he would like to buy another car and construct a better house.

loans.use: School.

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Victoria se dedica al comercio de cosméticos, y también trabaja como docente para poder solventar con los gastos de su hogar. Pues siempre ha sido una mujer activa.
Hoy en día sigue laborando como maestra y en su tiempo libre se dedica al comercio, de cosméticos el cual trabaja por catálogos, dando al crédito el 60 por ciento su mercadería.
Comenzó con pocos productos, lo que mejoro con financiamiento de la institución en donde comienza a comprar más variedad de cosméticos y capta  clientes, dando un mejor resultado de colocación y ganancias. Estos préstamos han sido de gran beneficio para su economía familiar.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo será su onceavo crédito en donde comprara mercadería encargada y más mercadería. Como: tinte para cabello, ropa para dama y caballeros, ropa interior así como muchos cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en:
Victoria sells cosmetics.  She also works as a teacher to cover her household expenses.  She has always been an active woman.

Victoria continues to work as a teacher and, in her spare time, she sells cosmetics from catalogs.  She provides 60% of her merchandise on credit.  She started out with few products but she improved her business with loans from Afodenic.  She started to buy a wider variety of cosmetics and attracted customers.  This helped improve her profits.  These loans have been of great financial benefit to her family.  Victoria will use this new loan (her eleventh) to buy ordered merchandise and additional merchandise such as: hair dyes, women's and men's clothes, underwear and a lot of Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy a large variety of cosmetics as well as women's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar tiene su negocio que es la venta de sacos vacios y envases plásticos. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación por lo que ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente. El tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de sacos vacios y venderlos más baratos.
texts.en: Julio Cesar's business is selling empty sacks and plastic containers.  This is not the first time that he has had loans from Fundación Leon 2000 and he has been an excellent client.  He has a large number of different customers who always come to buy the products that he offers.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy empty sacks and sell them more cheaply.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia, D. 62 años, es una madre D. familia muy  cumplidora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, su hija y su nieta. El primer negocio que tuvo fue una bodega, pero con el tiempo fracasó; desD. entonces decidió cambiar D. rubro, y ahora expenD. desayuno D. manera ambulante. Es así que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar bebidas nutricionales como: quinua, maca, soya, asimismo prepara sándwich; en el que luego son expendidos en la puerta del colegio D. su distrito. Está contenta con el negocio que tiene, ya que le ha resultado rentable; sin embardo es muy agotador y al final del día su cuerpo siente las dolencias. Par el futuro desea reabrir su antiguo negocio, por instalará la puerta interior D. su bodega. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, como hasta ahora. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería e insumos para continuar preparando estos alimentos.
texts.en:
62 year-old Herminia is a very reliable mother who lives in her own home together with her husband, her daughter and her granddaughter.  The first business that she had was a small grocery store but, over time, it failed.  She decided to change business and now she sells breakfasts as an itinerant street vendor.  Every day she gets up very early to prepare nutritional drinks such as: 'quinua' (a quinoa drink), 'maca' (a hot drink maD. from maca – a native root vegetable) and soya.  She also prepares sandwiches.  She sells her products at the entrance to the local school.  She is happy with the business that she has since it has proven to be profitable.  However, it is very tiring and, at the end of the day, she feels aches and pains in her body.  In the future, she would like to re-open her old business, installing an interior door to her grocery store.

This is Herminia's ninth loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has up until now.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise and supplies to continue preparing her food and drinks.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies for preparing food and drinks

loans.name: Sara Miguelina

texts.es:
La señora Sara es socia del banco comunal las Almendras, Distrito de calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y está casada.  Tiene un hijo en su poder, lleva 11 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
Ella se dedica a dar servicio de alquiler de cuartos, titene todo el segundo piso de su casa destinado para alquilar, y aun está acondicionando más espacios vacios para seguir alquilando, porque le genera buenos ingresos ya que se encuentra en un buen lugar.
 Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 soles comprara; 20 planchas de calamina, 10 listones, 1 kg de clavo de calamina, 1 kg de clavo de 3 pulgadas, y 6 planchas de triplay, que los necesita para acondicionar una habitación más.
La señora Sara, todos estos años, ha estado invirtiendo en los arreglos de su casa, que le sirve como fuente de ingreso y con el que está educando a su hijo, por eso agradece bastante  a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Las Almendras community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 65 years old and married, with a child in her care.  Sara has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 11 years.

Sara rents out rooms.  The entire second floor of her house is rented out and she is adapting even more empty spaces so that she can continue renting.  It makes her good money as she is in a good location.

Sara will use this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy 20 corrugated metal sheets, 10 beams, 1kg of nails for use with corrugated metal, 1kg of 3 inch nails and 6 sheets of plywood which she needs to adapt another room.

Over all these years, Sara has been investing in making repairs to her house which serves as a source of income.  This has enabled her to educate her child.  For this reason, she is quite grateful to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 52 años, es una madre de familia dedicada, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija. El negocio al que se dedica Rosa, es la venta de accesorios de ferretería, ofreciendo este servicio de manera delivery.  Es así que siempre esta en constante actividad, entregando los pedidos y realizando los cobros progresivos de los créditos que da a sus clientes, quienes aún confían en su negocio, a pesar que en un inicio fracasó su comercio de ferretería cuando lo ejercía en su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la comunicación que tiene con sus clientes, además le resulta muy rentable. Es así, con el pasar del tiempo, vende accesorios de ferretería de acuerdo a lo que le piden, exceptuando los materiales de construcción. Su mayor anhelo, es volver a reaperturar su negocio y de esa manera llevar un vida más sosegada. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar a tiempo sus cuotas  para acceder a posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más mercaderías entre brocas, clavos, enchufes, entre otras herramientas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, is a devoted mother living in her own house with her husband and daughter.  Rosa’s business is selling hardware accessories that she home delivers.  She is in constant activity this way delivering orders and collecting progressive payments from her customers who trust her business despite her having failed when she installed a hardware store in her home.  What she enjoys most about the work is the communication she has with her customers.  Besides it’s quite profitable.

This is how with the passage of time she’s been selling hardware accessories according to orders she gets excepting major building materials and supplies.  Her greatest hope is to reopen her business in order to have a more calm existence.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and knows that she has to pay on time in order to access future loans.

She will use the loan to increase stock merchandise like: drill bits and electrical plugs, among other things.

loans.use: To buy more tools and accessories to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 9 años.
La señora consuelo es madre soltera y tiene que trabajar para educar a su hijo que está en edad escolar, con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 soles inicio su negocio de venta de comidas.
Todas las mañanas se va al mercado para comprar pescado, plátano, chorizo, pollo, y los ingredientes  que necesita  para preparar sus Juanes (comida típica).
Con este préstamo de S/.  1,000.00 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una parilla de fierro, un saco de carbón, ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, servilletas, ½ doc. de vasos.
La señora Consuelo agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo lo ha podido lograr hasta el momento, que le sirve para poder darle a su hijo todo lo que necesita.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the 'Las Almendras' community bank, located in Ucayli department.  She is 45 years old and has a 9 year-old child.

Consuelo is a single mother and she has to work to educate her school-age son.  She set up her business selling food with her first loan for 300 Peruvian soles.  Every morning she goes to the market to buy fish, bananas, chorizo, chicken, and the ingredients she needs to prepare her 'Juanes' (traditional food).

Consuelo will invest this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles in buying an iron grill, a sack of charcoal, ½ sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, napkins, ½ dozen cups.

Consuelo is grateful to Manuela Ramos for everything that she has been able to manage up to this point which has enabled her to give her son everything he needs.

loans.use: To buy an iron grill, a sack of charcoal, ½ sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, napkins, ½ dozen cups

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Oscar Bonifacio

texts.en:
Oscar is forty-three years old.  He lives in the village of Valle San Juan in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  The region is semi-tropical and is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers.  Many locals have fruit plantations or raise animals.  Oscar lives along with his mother and his sister.  He is single and has no children.

In corrals near his home, Oscar raises sheep and fowl (including ducks, chickens and turkeys).  He raises the animals for their meat or other products, selling them in local markets or to neighbors once the animals reach the appropriate size and weight.  In addition to raising animals, Oscar owns a hectare of crop land on which he has lime trees.  He harvests limes each week given the continual growing season in the area.

Oscar has good personal and business references.  He plans to use the loan to purchase additional feed for his animals and fertilizers for his crops.  He expects that the investment will improve the general health and production of his farm.  In this manner he hopes to be able to improve his family’s lifestyle and be able to better provide for his sister and mother.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed for his animals and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is fifty-two years old.  He lives along with his wife and their three children.  The family maintains a stable and a happy home.  They live in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  It is a semi-tropical region in which many small farmers own small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Arturo is a farmer.  He raises sheep and maintains two hectares of mango and lime fields.  He raises the sheep in corrals near his home.  He raises them for meat and other products and sells the animals in local markets when they reach the appropriate size and weight.  He harvests mangos and limes regularly from his fields, given the extended growing season in the region.  Between these two activities Arturo is able to maintain a relatively stable income and provide for his family.

The loan will be used to purchase additional balanced feed for his animals and make repairs to his corrals.  He hopes that this action will improve the health and production of his sheep, thus improving the profits of the business.  He dreams of having a larger herd and additional land to raise them on.  He hopes to be able to continue using his business to meet his family's needs and provide additional opportunities to his children.

loans.use: Purchase additional balanced feed for his animals and make repairs to his corrals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mototaxi

loans.name: Rafael Daniel

texts.en:
Rafael is twenty-three years old.  He lives in a rural portion of Jose Leonard Ortiz, a large neighborhood on the northern side of the city of Chiclayo.  Jose Leonardo Ortiz is famous in the northern deserts of Peru for its massive wholesale market which is called the market of Moshoqueque.  Rafael was raised in the area, having lived there for over twenty years.  He currently resides with his wife and his two young children.

Three years ago, Rafael purchased a mototaxi (an automated rickshaw).  Since then he has been running the mototaxi on a regular basis, providing transportation services to residents of the city of Chiclayo and nearby areas.  He carries his passengers to and from work, meals, shopping trips, or social events.  Additionally, at times he is contracted to haul large quantities of merchandise or construction supplies in order to restock local businesses.

The loan will be used to make repairs to Rafael’s mototaxi, given that it is now an older machine in need of a general overhaul and a few new parts.  Rafael hopes that this will reduce his ongoing maintenance expenses and help him to continue using the mototaxi for the long term.

Rafael has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past.  This will be his third loan with our institution.  He has used credit responsibly in the past and paid on time.  He has good references among his neighbors and local businesses.

loans.use: To make repairs to his mototaxi

loans.name: Flor Angel

texts.es:
La señora Flor socia del banco comunal El Oriente, del distrito de Campo verde, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña como chofer (transportista)y tiene 4 hijos.
Con su primer préstamo, comenzó su negocio de venta de comida para ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos, por que el trabajo que tiene su esposo no genera muchos ingresos para su hogar.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 soles la señora comprará una parrilla, 1 saco de carbón, ½ saco de arroz, 3 litros de aceite, 1/2 kilo de ajinomoto, 2 litros de vinagre, 3 pollos y 5 kilos de chanco para los chicharrones, 1 racimo de plátano y demás demás condimentos.
La señora Flor agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos, sobre todo para las personas que quieran poner un pequeño negocio puedan acceder a un crédito sin muchos requisitos más que su DNI y sus ganas de trabajar.
texts.en: Flor is a member of El Oriente community bank in the district of Campo Verde, department of Ucayali, Peru. She is 44 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver and they have four children. With her initial loan, she started her business selling food so she could help her husband with some expenses since he doesn't make a lot of money with his job. With this new loan of 1,200 soles, Flor plans to purchase a grill, a sack of charcoal, a half-sack of rice, 3 liters of oil, a half-kilo of spices, 2 liters of vinegar, three chickens, one bunch of bananas, and other items. Flor is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the loans, and above all the people who helped her start her small business by granting the loan with nothing more than her ID and her desire to work.

loans.use: Purchase a grill, a bag of charcoal, a half-sack of rice, 3 liters of oil, half-kilo of spices, 2 liters of vinegar, one bunch of bananas, and other items

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia D. banco comunal Las almendras, D. Distrito D. Calleria y Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 58 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos, su primer préstamo en Manuela Ramos  fue D. S/.300.00, con ese dinero comenzó su negocio.
Nora trabaja haciendo los deliciosos tamales, rellenos, manteca, chicharrones, chorizos (cómidas típicas) y los venD. todas las mañanas en un mercado cerca a su casa, termina temprano y le da tiempo para ir a preparar  el almuerzo y hacer otras actividades D. su hogar.
Con éste préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00 soles comprará: 5 sacos D. maíz, 1 bolsa D. cal, 3 kilos D. aceitunas, un paquete D. sal 3 kilos D. maní, 3 casilleros D. huevo,  condimentos, soga para amarrar sus tamalitos.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos la señora Nora todavía pueD. pagar los estudios D. su último hijo que está en la universidad.
texts.en: Nora is a member of Las Almendras (The Almonds) community bank in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali, Peru. She is 58 years old, married and has seven children. Her first loan with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles, and she used this money to start her business. Nora works making delicious tamales and other regional dishes that she sells every morning at a market near her home. She finishes early in the day, which gives her time to prepare lunch and do other chores in her home. With this loan of 1,200 soles, she plans to purchase 5 sacks of corn, a bag of lime, 3 kilos of olives, a package of salt, 3 kilos of peanuts, 3 cartons of eggs, condiments and ropes to tie up her tamales. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Nora can still pay for her youngest child's college education.

loans.use: Purchase 5 sacks of corn, 1 bag of lime, 3 kilos of olives, one package of salt, 3 kilos of peanuts, 3 cartons of eggs, condiments, and rope to tie up her tamales.

loans.name: Mirian Rosmilda

texts.es:
La señora Mirian Rosmilda es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años, y está  casada. Tiene 2 niños menores y su esposo es ingeniero forestal.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de adornos de todo tipo, ahora se encuentra produciendo adornos de navidad, que por estos meses están siendo muy pedidos.
Hace 3 años viene solicitando préstamos a Manuela Ramos, con ese dinero Mirian compra los materiales que necesita para seguir produciendo más adornos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 soles comprará: 25 planchas de corrospu, de diferentes colores, 200 gr de  escarcha de diferentes colores, 6 plumones indelebles, 1 frasco de silicona, lapiceros, goma, tijeras y otros materiales que necesita.
La señora Mirian tiene buenos ingresos con la venta de sus manualidades y  agradece que Manuela Ramos pueda ayudar a las mujeres que necesitan trabajar, dispone de su dinero y  puede comprarles a sus hijos lo que necesitan, sin afectar el dinero de sus gastos básicos.
texts.en:
Mirian Rosmilda is a member of the village bank group Las Almendras, in the Ucayali region.  She is 30 years old and married. She has 2 small children and her husband is a forester.

She works at making and selling ornaments of every kind.  Right now she is producing Christmas ornaments, for which there are many orders these months.

She has been taking loans for 3 years from Manuela Ramos and with that money Mirian buys the necessary materials for producing more ornaments.

With this new loan of 1,500 PEN she will buy: 25 foam sheets of different colors, 200 grams of frost in different colors, 6 indelible markers, 1 vial of silicone, pens, glue, scissors and other materials she needs.

Mirian makes a good income from selling her crafts and thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women who need work earn money and for enabling her to buy necessities for her children without affecting the money for her basic expenses.

loans.use: she will buy: 25 foam sheets of different colors, 200 grams of frost in different colors, 6 indelible markers, 1 vial of silicone, pens, glue, scissors and other materials she needs to make Christmas ornaments for sale.

loans.name: Blanca Nieves

texts.es:
La señora Blanca es socia del banco comunal Las Margaritas, del Distrito de Calleria. Tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y ha tenido que trabajar bastante para poder educar a su único hijo que ahora ya es adulto e independiente, lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años.
Todo estos años la señora Blanca se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de catalogo, perfumería, hasta ahora todo le va muy bien, cuenta con un stock de productos el cual los vende a crédito.

Blanca vive sola y con lo que trabaja le alcanza para poder mantenerse y también para pagar sus cuotas mensuales.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 soles comprará una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, también comprará 3 perfumes, 5 champús, 10 desodorantes, 5 talcos, 5  lápiz labiales, 3 polvos para cara, 2 cremas para rostro, 2 rubores, 5 cremas para mano, 2 cremas para cuerpo.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos la señora Blanca ha logrado hacer un pequeño capital, que le permite trabajar a crédito.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas" in the Calleria district.  She is 55 years old and is a single mother who has had to work a lot to educate her only son, who is now an adult and is independent.  She has been taking loans from Manuela Ramos for 10 years.

All these years Blanca has been selling cosmetics from a catalog.  Up to this point it has gone very well.  She has an inventory of products that she sells on credit.  Blanca lives alone and with what she earns she is able to support herself and also make her monthly loan payments.  With this loan  of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will buy a display case to exhibit her products.  In addition, she will buy 3 perfumes, 5 shampoos, 10 deodorants, 5 powders, 5 lipsticks, 3 foundations, 2 face creams, 2 units of blush, 5 hand creams, and 2 body creams.  

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Blanca has managed to accumulate a small amount of capital that will allow her to give credit to her customers.

loans.use: she will buy a display case to exhibit her products, and in addition she will buy: 3 perfumes, 5 shampoos, 10 deodorants, 5 powders, 5 lipsticks, 3 foundations, 2 face creams, 2 units of blush, 5 hand creams, and 2 body creams.

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en: Anhbayar T. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 7-year-old daughter in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver and operates a taxi to support his family, while her daughter attends a primary school. Anhbayar has been operating a barber shop since 2003 and has built a stable and successful operation. Over the years, she has increased her business with many loyal clients. For the future, she hopes to open her own hair salon equipped with the latest technology and tools. She is a modest and honest woman and says, "I am planning to save more money by building this business into a stable operation in order to pay my daughter's tuition fees in the future."  She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car for herself.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Jesucito Group

texts.es:
Lorenza participa en la Alcancía Comunal “JESUCITO” como tesorera hace 8 meses y está conformada por 7 integrantes.
Lorenza se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes hace 10 años junto con sus padres que además se dedican a la agricultura en un anexo de la zona donde vive y para ir a aquel lugar deben caminar por el lapso de una hora viajar en burro o en auto pero estos no van  frecuentemente. En sus chacras siembran y cosechan Alfalfa. Lo cual comercializan y además alimenta a sus cuyes. Con su esfuerzo y el de su esposo que trabaja en construcción civil ha logrado realizar mejoras en su vivienda y adquirir algunos electrodomésticos, Lorenza es una persona que no le gusta derrochar el dinero o hacer gastos innecesarios ella prefiere el ahorro, nos manifiesta que si tuviera más dinero lo invertiría en su vivienda y para su negocio. Su préstamo será invertido en su vivienda junto con las ganancias de su negocio.
Lorenza y las integrantes de su alcancía Comunal son personas alegres y están muy contentas de pertenecer al programa prosperidad y están cumpliendo en sus pagos para seguir contando con su prestamos.
texts.en:
Lorenza has participated in the "Jesucito" borrower group as treasurer for 8 months.  The group consists of 7 members.

Lorenza has been engaged in raising guinea pigs for sale for 10 years along with her parents who are also engaged in agriculture in an annex next to where she lives.  In order to go there they must walk for an hour or travel by car or donkey, but these do not come frequently.  They plant and harvest alfalfa in their fields, which they sell in commercial markets and also use to feed her guinea pigs. 

Through her efforts and her husband's work in construction, she has made major improvements in her home and has bought some appliances.  Lorenza is a person who does not like wasting money or making unnecessary expenditures.  She prefers saving she tells us if she had more money that she would invest it in her home and her business. 

Lorenza and the members of her group are happy people and are very glad to belong to the Prosperity program and are making their payments in order to continue the loan.

loans.use: materials for improving her home and business

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad con los cuales reside en el sector Mochumanos del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola conformada por varias localidades pequeñas consideradas como zonas rurales, el lugar se encuentra en la provincia de Ferreñafe y se ubica a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace más de cinco años, ella cuenta con una parcela de cultivo de 1.5 has. En donde suele sembrar maíz, María cuenta con bastante conocimiento del manejo de estos cultivos y depende los ingresos que le brinde esta actividad para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Adicionalmente cuenta con algunas vacas de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para vendérselas a sus vecinos y a un acopiador.

María desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz aplicándoles fertilizantes, pesticidas y riegos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir los productos que necesita, entre ellos gasolina, la cual utiliza para alimentar un motor que extrae agua de un pozo cercano.
texts.en: María Esther is 39 years old, separated from her husband, and has two young children who live in the sector of Mochumanos, district of Pitipo, which is a rural agricultural area consisting of various small localities in the province of Ferreñafe, an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has made a living in agriculture for the past five years. She has a parcel of land of 1.5 hectares, where she usually plants corn. María has a good knowledge of managing these crops and depends on the income from this activity to make headway for her children. Additionally, she has a few cows whose milk she sells to her neighbors. María wants to tend to her crops by applying fertilizers, pesticides and irrigation. To do so, she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to allow her to acquire the products she needs, which include gasoline to power a motor to extract water from a nearby well.

loans.use: Maintain corn crops

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola tiene 41 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a dos de sus hijos en el anexo San Miguel del caserío Cruz del Médano, una zona agrícola que se encuentra poblada por gente humilde y muy trabajadora. Pertenece al distrito de Mórrope y se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella cría cerdos, patos y gallinas en diversos ambientes situados e la parte exterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general en el Mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Bartola es una mujer que gusta mucho de sentirse activa y de luchar por el bienestar de los hijos que aun tiene a su cargo. Por ello siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si en su labor para sacarlos adelante. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y comida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Bartola, 41, is separated and lives with her two children in San Miguel Annex, Cruz del Médano, a farming area populated by humble, very hard working people.  It belongs to Mórrope district and is located over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For two years she has been raising small farm animals to sell.  She raises pigs, ducks and chickens in various habitats in her back yard.  When they reach a good level of growth she sells them to the general public in Chiclayo’s Moshoqueque Market.
