Bartola is a woman who very much likes to feel active and to fight for the wellbeing of the children still in her care.  For this reason she always strives to give her best at work to see that they get ahead.  

She wants to expand her business acquiring more animals and feed so she has deemed it advisable to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy animals and nutritionally balanced animal feed for them.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijo en el sector La Esperanza del distrito de Reque, una zona rural de pobladores humildes que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas, específicamente a la siembra de verduras. El ha arrendado un terreno en donde ha instalado el cultivo de tomate, Manuel cuenta con bastante conocimiento acerca del cultivo de verduras y se esta valiendo de ellos para sacar adelante a su familia y progresar en la vida.

 Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros dentro de su localidad y en las zonas aledañas. Para lo cual se vale de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte).

Manuel desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo para asegurarse una buena cosecha, por ello desea adquirir algunas medicinas que prevengan la aparición de planas en su plantación de tomates. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Manuel, 32, is a father living with his wife and son in the La Esperanza sector of Reque district, a rural area populated by humble people who are mostly farmers.  It is located over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He is a farmer, specifically of vegetables.  He has rented a field where he is growing tomatoes.  Manuel has quite a bit of knowledge about vegetable farming and he’s using it for his family’s wellbeing and to progress in life.

In addition, he provides passenger and cargo transportation services within his locality and in neighboring zones for which he uses a mototaxi (motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used for transport).

Manuel wants to provide maintenance to his plants to insure a good harvest so wants to buy some medicines that will prevent plagues in his tomato plants.  To do this, therefore, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: For tomato crop care.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El suele criar ovejas en algunos corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Elmer desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más ovejas y alimento balanceado de modo que la crianza de sus animales mejore y estos puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elmer, 26, is married living with his family in the Muy Finca sector of Mochumí district, a farming zone located in Lambayeque region.

He works in farming, especially raising small farm animals.  He tends to raise sheep in some corrals in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to come by the area where he lives.  The business is an important source of income for the family so he strives to keep it the best way possible.

Elmer wants to expand the business acquiring more sheep and nutritionally balanced feed so that their development will improve and they will be sold at a better price.

To reach this goal, therefore, he has seen fit to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy sheep and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum S. is a widowed woman who has lived in the Kampong Chhnang Province since 1980 working as a primary school teacher. She has four married children who live outside her home, and two single children under her roof: a daughter who is also a primary school teacher and a son who is now working in the military. Her daughter, who is a teacher, is also a part-time tailor for local needs. This is the reason for Chum's loan to buy cloth and a sewing machine. She could earn about $4 per day at maximum. Her dream is to support her daughter's successes in business and have a better home.

loans.use: To buy cloth and a sewing machine

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que se pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El suele criar sus animales en algunos corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside y al público en general. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Alexander desea adquirir animales menores y alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 25-year-old single man who lives with his family in the Muy Finca sector of the Mochumi district, an agricultural zone in the Chiclayo province, located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

He works in agriculture, especially in raising and selling small animals. He usually raises his animals in pens located in his back yard. When they have reached the optimum stage of development, he sells them to both the general public and to resellers in his zone of residence. This business is an important source of income for supporting his household, which is why he always tries to maintain it as best as he can.

Alexander would like to expand his business by obtaining more small animals and feed in order to earn greater profits for his sales. In order to reach his goal, he sees fit to request a 1,500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase small animals and feed

loans.name: Melchor

texts.es:
Melchor tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola poblada por personas humildes, trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores. El suele criar sus animales en algunos corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. El negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos con la cual sostiene la economía de su familia, por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Melchor desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo animales menores y alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Melchor is a 47-year-old married man who lives with his family in the Punto Cuatro hamlet of the Mochumi district, an agricultural zone inhabited by humble and hardworking people with the desire to get ahead.

He raises and sells small animals for a living. He normally raises his animals in pens located in his back yard. When they have reached the optimum stage of development, he sells them to both the general public and to resellers in his zone of residence. This business is his main source of income with which he supports his household, which is why he always tries to maintain it as best as he can.

Melchor would like to expand his business by obtaining more small animals and feed in order to earn greater profits for his sales. In order to reach his goal, he sees fit to request a 1,500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase small animals and feed

loans.name: Greicie Edith

texts.es:
Greicie es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus festividades religiosas, es una zona medianamente comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de primera necesidad, entre abarrotes, verduras y demás perecibles. Su clientela prefiere su negocio ya que siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato, el negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Greicie desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio y satisfacer a la demanda con la que cuenta. Para ello ha creído coveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Greicie is a 35-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Motupe district, a zone that is well-known for its religious festivities. It is a quasi-commercial zone that is located in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

She runs a general store from home, where she sells various basic need items, provisions, vegetables, and other perishable goods. Her customers choose her store because she always offers high-quality products and good customer service. This business allows her to help her husband maintain their household. 

Greicie would like to obtain more goods so that she can expand her business and meet customer demand. For this reason, she sees fit to request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can reach her goal.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan A. is 50 years old and earns living income by selling fish in her village. She is married to Um Cheoun and has two children. Every morning, she hurries to the riverside to get fish from her husband and then rides on her bicycle through the village, selling fish. Her husband is a motor-driver. Her dream is to see her child finish a bachelor degree and to have a better house for living. One of her children is a seller of products such as soft drinks, food, sweets and cooking ingredient for people who live nearby and around her village. Chan A.’s child is now looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more inventory to increase her profits. This is the reason why Chan A. requests a loan for Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to increase her profits.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es una madre de familia que tiene 36 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada dentro de la provincia de Lambayeque a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de primera necesidad, entre abarrotes, verduras y demás perecibles. Su clientela prefiere su negocio ya que siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato. El negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte), la cual alquila para brindar servicio de transporte en su comunidad.

Faustina desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio y satisfacer a la demanda con la que cuenta. Para ello ha creído coveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Faustina is a 36-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Olmos district, an agricultural and commercial zone that is located in the Lambayeque province, almost two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

She runs a general store from home, where she offers various basic need items, provisions, vegetables, and other perishable goods. Her customers choose her store because she always offers high-quality products and good customer service. This business allows her to help her husband maintain their household.

She also owns a motorcycle taxi--a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a cab--which she uses for transporting passengers in her community.

Faustina would like to obtain more goods so that she can expand her business and meet customer demand. For this reason, she sees fit to request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can reach her goal.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 30 years old. Virgie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el sector Boca Chica del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la agricultura y comercialización de cítricos en general. La zona en donde vive se caracteriza por producir este tipo de frutos, Luis Alberto los cultiva en un terreno de cultivo de su propiedad y sus cosechas las ofrece en venta a los acopiadores del lugar. Adicionalmente adquiere cítricos a sus vecinos para comercializarlos posteriormente. El negocio es una de sus principales fuente de ingresos por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantenerlo.

Luis Alberto desea contar con algún capital disponible que le permita adquirir su mercadería rápidamente durante la presente campaña de cosecha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a 37-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the Boca Chica sector of the Olmos district, an agricultural and commercial zone that is located in the Lambayeque province, over two hours away from Chiclayo.

He grows and sells citrus for a living. The zone in which he lives is well-known for producing this type of fruit. Luis Alberto grows citrus in an orchard that he owns, and he sells the fruit to local resellers. He also obtains citrus fruits from his neighbors. This business is one of his main sources of income, which is why he gives his all to maintain it.

Luis Alberto would like to have some working capital so that he can obtain merchandise quicker during this harvesting season, which is why he sees fit to request a 1,500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. is a 26 years old and married, living in Kampong Tom Province. Her husband, Kim Chanmieng, 29, is a local construction worker for nearly ten years. They have two children who are in school. Chea S. is looking for a loan of US$ 500 to buy a wooden flat mold and a set of construction wood for local housing construction for her husband. What they hope for in the future is for their children to get bachelors degrees and support them when they grow old. 

Note: Chea S. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy wooden flat mold and a set of construction wood for local housing construction for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beef

loans.name: Mam

texts.en: Mam K. is 60 years old and lives in Kampong Tom Province. She is a local farmer of a plot she was given by her parents. She is married to Uch Phieng, 63, who is also a local farmer. They have two married children living separately and one school-aged child living with them. She is now looking for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy ducks and duck feed because she wants to increase her income from home. Her spouse hopes that their children can finish university degrees.

loans.use: To buy ducks and duck feed because she wants to increase her income from home.

loans.name: Giovanna Consuelo

texts.es:
Giovanna tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante  comercial que se encuentra situada a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la comercialización de prendas de vestir y calzado para todo público. Ella cuenta con un stock permanente de mercadería la cual ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes tanto al crédito como al contado. Su negocio siempre cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la calidad de los productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda, los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Giovanna desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, de modo que pueda obtener mayores ingresos y rentabilidad por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de mejorar la calidad de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a 33-year-old married woman who lives with her family in the Olmos district, an agricultural and commercial zone located one hour and forty-five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling apparel and footwear for 3 years. She has permanent inventory, which she sells to her neighbors and customers both for cash and on credit. Her business is popular because of the high-quality products that she offers, as well as her great customer service. She uses the income from the business to help her husband support the family.

Giovanna would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can obtain bigger profits from her sales. For this reason, she thinks that it is worthwhile to request a 500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can reach her goals. She is a woman with a strong desire to get ahead and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el sector Chuin del distrito de Paiján, una zona comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Ascope en la región La Libertad. Se encuentra situada a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a vender alfalfa en su moto carguera. El cultiva este forraje en un terreno de cultivo situado cerca a la zona en donde reside. Diariamente siega la alfalfa para ofrecerla en venta en el distrito de Paiján y en sus alrededores. Para realizar esta acción se vale de su moto carguera, el negocio es una fuente bastante importante de ingresos con la que solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia. Adicionalmente utiliza su moto carguera para brindar servicio de transporte de carga en sus ratos libres.

José desea adquirir algunas medicinas que ayude a su alfalfa con la prevención de futuras plagas, asimismo desea brindar mantenimiento a su moto carguera, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is a 21-year-old single man who lives with his parents and siblings in the Chuin sector of the Paijan district, a commercial zone in the Ascope province of the La Libertad region. It is located over two-and-a-half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He sells alfalfa using his cargo tricycle. He grows this fodder in a crop field near his zone of residence. He harvests alfalfa everyday so that he can sell it in the Paijan district and in surrounding communities. In order to do so, he uses his cargo tricycle. This business is a vital source of income with which he covers personal expenses and helps out his family. He also uses this motorcycle to offer cargo transportation services in his spare time.

Jose would like to obtain pesticides that will help prevent future pest infestations. He would also like to give maintenance to his cargo tricycle, which is why he thinks it is advisable to request 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Pesticides and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men S., 27, a vegetable seller at Ramloong market, in Kampong Tom Province is looking for a loan to buy one motorbike for transportation and to invest in her vegetable sales. She is married to Va Nol, 33, who is a local farmer who plants vegetables on their farmland. They said this motorbike will help them a lot in their business. In the future, they hope they can buy a small transport truck and send their beloved child to university.

loans.use: To buy one motorbike for transportation and to invest in her vegetable selling.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlyn S. is 39 years of age and married. She is a resident of Bocator, Tangub City. She is blessed with children all of whom are now adults. Her husband Dionesio is presently engaged in fishing and earning an average income of at least P300.00 a week. She joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she is very interested in their products and services. PAGLAUM MPC is one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and was awarded Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the COOP-LGU Partnership Award of 2006.  She is requesting the amount of P3,000.00 for her 1st loan. This loan will be used to add capital to their existing fish vending business. The couple has strong determination that someday their business will be successful.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business

loans.name: Chark

texts.en: Chark S. is looking for a loan to rebuild parts of her house. She is married to Chea Nhor who is the same age as her, 31, and earns a living as a local motor-driver. They lately had one little child. Chark S. wants become a grocery seller, live in a better and taller house, and send her child to university.

loans.use: To rebuild parts of her house.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of five people located in Reang Dek village in Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Kong S., a 39-year-old married woman, as the group leader. Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Kong S. and her husband, Mr. Sok Chea, are fishermen who are able to earn some income to support their family living. They don’t have enough fishing supplies for fishing, so Mrs. Kong S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase fishing supplies. This couple are fishermen who work very hard to support their six children. One of their children is a fisherman, one is a security guard, and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fishing supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Venecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Venecia G. is 57 years of age, married, and a resident of Bocator, Tangub City, Mis. Occ. She is married to Tomas G., a fisherman and laborer in their barangay (village). They are blessed with 1 child who is married already. She helped her husband in growing their business by engaging in fish vending. For 10 years she has been able to sustain their business, and at this time she is earning an average income of P3,000.00 a month. She joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she is very interested in their products and services. As a newly recognized borrower, she is requesting 4,000.00 for her 1st loan to add capital to her fish vending business. The future income from this loan will be used for loan repayments and savings for her future, especially for her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam V. is a 52 year old married woman, and she is a villager who lives in Kampong Samnanh village, Kandal province. 

Mrs. Sam V. is a seamstress in a garment factory where she can earn a little salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bo Sophat, 53 years old, works as an electrician. Due to the fact that her working place is far from her house she wants to buy a motorcycle, but she doesn’t have enough money to buy it. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a motorcycle for transportation. 

This couple has three children: two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and one of whom is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlyn T. is from the Barangay of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Merlyn is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Merlyn T.’s Group. 

Merlyn T. is 37 years-old and married to Dexter T.. They are blessed with two children who are school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in banana production. Her husband is also giving her regular support from his income as a motor “jabal-jabal” driver. She’s been engaged in her business for ten years. She earns an average amount of not less than Php 2,000.00 a month from sales from this business. 

In the year 2007, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 10,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php 40,000.00 as her sixth loan. This loan will be used to purchase a second hand motorcycle. The future income from this business will be used to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments and pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of 2nd hand motorcycle unit

loans.name: 06.02.09 Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
Minh N. T. (47) is a 27 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Minh is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09-Dong hai (16.02.09 Dong Hai).


Minh is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, Minh owns and operates a clothing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing clothing alteration and tailoring services to local community members.  Minh has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting her first loan of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  Minh plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  H. T. Nhan (3) is a 32 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


2.  L. T. Xa (36) is a 49 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  B. T. Tuyen (45) is a 23 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  N. T. Huong (31) is a 44 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  L. T. Sau (46) is a 45 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Minh N. T. (47) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Minh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 09-Dong hai (16.02.09 Dong Hai).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Minh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Minh kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 0, Minh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Minh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  H. T. Nhan (3) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


2.  L. T. Xa (36) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  B. T. Tuyen (45) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. T. Huong (31) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  L. T. Sau (46) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito M. is from the village of Benito, Soliven, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Jovito is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovito owns and operates a farm, raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Jovito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Jovito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Jovito is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jovito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia M. is 44 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a livestock business. She lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Datag, Siaton, Negors Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her livestock business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Cynthia is now borrowing PHP 13,000. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cynthia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

Gina J. is from the barangay of Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married and blessed with one child who is school age. To make a living, she makes choco balls and munchkins. She's been in this business for three months and earns approximately 4,200 PHP per month.

In 2008, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Gina has successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her existing choco ball and munchkin business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. She hopes to save money for future use, make loan repayments, pay for her child’s education and possibly business expansions.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma R., 41, lives in Pasay City, Philippines. She is married and has one child who she has managed, with the grace of God, to provide with a good education. Now she is working hard simply to meet daily expenses by running a small variety store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her regular customers are her neighbors and she earns about PHP 200 a day. 

She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to expand her business by buying more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to continue operating a stable business that will allow her to continue paying for her child's education. She faithfully meets weekly with her other borrowers to talk about her work.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather regularly to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay their loans.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina R., age 60, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She has a child who stays at home to manage the household and help her with the business. By the grace of God, Avelina has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Avelina operates a computer rental shop. As very few people own their own computers or laptops here in the Philippines, there is a great need for computer services, especially for students who must frequently do research and typing jobs. Avelina rents out her computer units by the hour and offers printing and scanning services to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy a new computer unit to increase her computer fleet. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Avelina hopes to have good health for the remainder of her days and also a conspicuous improvement on her business statistics. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Buy a new computer unit to increase her computer fleet

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna L., 31, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Lambert L., a computer technician, and together they have an elementary-aged kid staying at home managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Lorna has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Lorna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at a wholesale price and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lorna hopes that business will improve and pick up soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino A. is from the village of Manaoag, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Marcelino is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marcelino plants and harvests corn to sell. Marcelino has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Marcelino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. Marcelino is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marcelino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marlita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlita buys and sells seafood products, including fish like bariles & sardines. Marlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like mackerel and milk fish. This Marlita's 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like mackerel & milk fish

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. is from the village of Rizal, West San Isidro. She is 46 years old, married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the arts sector operating a weaving business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month.

In 2008, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make woven products. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase raw materials to make woven products. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make woven products.

loans.name: Luzviminda's Group

texts.en:
Luzviminda L. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, in the province of Isabela. She is 33 years old. Luzviminda is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Luzviminda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling crispy pork skin "chicharon" in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2006, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 37000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Idayatkan's Group

texts.en:
Idayatkan B. has a traditionally large family of 5 children. Today all of those children are married, have their own families and daily chores, and live separately from parents.

Eleven years ago, the family decided to increase their budget using profits from breeding cattle. This business is now rather stable and provides a regular income from selling sheep and cows. These earnings have provided the opportunity to arrange their children’s weddings and prepare dowries for their daughters.

In order to improve the family's well-being, Idayatkan would like to increase their total number of farm animals and develop the business. This plan requires a certain amount of money, and for this reason the family hopes to receive a loan. In the future they would like to build a new shed in order to improve conditions in which they keep their cattle.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Or L. is a 26-year-old married man who currently works as a fortune-teller in his home. He makes approximately $6.66 per day in this occupation. Or L. is married to Phearoun, a 23-year-old hairdresser. They do not have any children yet. Or L.’s wife owns a salon, and she has a lot of regular clients who come to her shop. In order to increase her profits and make the business more successful, Or L. will use his loan to support his wife's business by purchasing more beauty supplies for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty supplies for his wife's business.

loans.name: Misal's Group

texts.en:
Misal K., 45, is the leader of this group. She is married to a private entrepreneur. The couple has two sons. Both of them are school boys. 
Since 1995, the family has lived on the profits made from their private business concerning trading. 15 years ago, Misal started to sell cotton oil in the local market, then, after increasing her earnings, she added household appliances in order to vary the assortment of her trade. 
In order to purchase heaters for re-selling and to make a profit, Misal wants to get a loan. In future the family wishes to obtain a car.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). loans.use: To purchase heaters for re-sale.

loans.name: Alfiya's Group

texts.en:
Alfiya B., 41, is married to a private taxi-driver. The couple is raising four children, all of whom are pupils in school. 

Traditionally, almost all villagers breed livestock. Alfiya’s family follows this tradition and currently keeps five cows and 15 sheep. Ten years ago, they purchased three sheep and began to fatten them for resale. Currently, the family is being supported financially by Alfiya’s husband. Sometimes in order to get extra money, they have to sell one of their animals. 

The family is planning to purchase an allotment for building a house, thus they need to purchase building materials.

	 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson N. is an individual client from Ntungamo. He is 50 years old and married with nine children. He is involved in agriculture whereby he sells matooke from Kyeiziga II cell. His customers are mostly from Kampala, Kyeiziga and Kabugo. In addition to this business, he is involved in the sale of cattle, milk and goat sales. Nelson needs a loan to be able to improve his ten-year-old banana plantation. His plantation is a family business and everyone is involved to help it succeed. He is happy that his loans have enabled his business to succeed as well as provide education for his children.

loans.use: To improve his banana plantation by purchasing manure.

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 44-year-old Or S.’s daily routine. Mrs. Or S. provides her service to her neighbors--sewing both traditional and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. Or S. is married to Socheat, 40, a policeman. They have two children who are students studying in public school in Phnom Penh City. Or S. is concerned that her old sewing machine is broken. This machine is the main tool for her business so Or S. is seeking a loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine in order to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Хамидова Мухабат жительница района Вахдат. Ей 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Рядом с аптекой арендует торговую точку, где продает свежие булочки. Уже 10 лет как занимается торговлей. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Muhabat H. is a resident of Vahdat.  She is 48 years old, married, and has four children.  She has a high school education.  She works in the town’s central market.  She rents a shop near a drugstore where she sells fresh rolls.  She has been working in sales for ten years.   She is taking out a loan to increase her sales.

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Asylgul's Group

texts.en:
Asylgul K. is a young woman of 26, she is the mother of three children; the two elder children are school pupils, and the youngest one is a toddler. 
In 2003, the family started to increase family budget after purchasing a calf and 5 goats, since that, this business is successfully being operated by Asylgul’s husband and their son. During 7 years of working hard, Asylgul has managed to make house repairs and increase the number of livestock up to 22 animals.

Obvious achievements don’t stop new plans concerning business development. Today the family needs to obtain hay for feeding animals and a sheep for breeding. For this purpose they need to get a loan. In future they wish to be able to obtain a car.

	 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

loans.use: To purchase sheep and hay.

loans.name: Altynai's Group

texts.en:
Altynai T., 44, is the leader of this group. She is married, and together with her spouse grows and gives proper upbringing to three children; all of them are at school.

The family makes their livelihood by having different jobs. The head of the family is a driver, concurrently he is engaged in coal selling. Altynai with the help of her son runs her own business: she sells detergents in the local market. She has been doing it for 6 years. Her profits have made it possible to purchase a car. 

In order to develop the business and to increase the variety of goods she sells, Altynai wants to purchase new goods, for this purpose she needs to get a loan. Next year she plans to help her elder son to enter university, then to arrange his marriage.

 	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

loans.use: To purchase more detergents for sale.

loans.name: Kicwamba Tukore Group

texts.en:
K. David is the leader of the Kicwamba Tukore group in Rukungiri.  He is 46 years old and married with five children aged 9 to 17 years old.  David has a carpentry business in Rwabibanga, where he makes finished chairs, tables, beds and sideboards.  He sells mostly to the rural population. 

David is able to make 180,000 per month in profit, in addition to the selling bananas.  He was inspired to start his business by his family members over nine years ago, and he needs a loan to buy timber for his carpentry workshop.  His dream is to move his carpentry workshop to the town center of Ruhinda.

loans.use: Buying timber for his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Rat

texts.en: Rat S., 64 years old, owns a small shop in the local Prey Tortoeung market, where she sells cooking ingredients to people that come to buy things in the market.  She typically makes ~ $3 of profit each day to meet her family's needs. She was married to Mr. Yan Yorng, who is a local farmer.  This couple has seven children, all of whom are married; some of them live separately in their own houses.  Rat S. will use this Kiva loan to purchase essential ingredients for cooking foods.

loans.use: To purchase essential ingredients for cooking foods
